Title: There were great parts, there were not-so-great parts
Text:
Pros:
-Beautiful beach area just steps away
-Lots of comfortable beach & pool chaises
-Umbrellas gallore
-Helpful lifeguards/pool attendants
-The *most* amazing beach bagno just next door with the best food we had (mere steps)
-Incredible view from the restaurant terrace
-Great breakfast - food & service
-Immaculately clean room, freshly painted
-Daily housekeeping PLUS fresh towel delivery in the evening (amazing if you showered off after the beach and then wanted to freshen for dinner as well)
-Very helpful staff - we were greeted by 6 different people and our bags taken up for us, it was a very warm welcome
-The thermal pool was well-heated and relaxing on the cooler days we were there.

Cons:
-The pool was quite literally green. In all the trip advisor photos it is very clearly the appropriate, clear, well cared for, swimming pool. It was, however, a slimy algae bath for our entire stay and the staff did not appear to care about the state of the pool at all..... incredibly bizarre. There is absolutely no point which a swimming pool should be a dark, murky green (think St. Patricks day clover green......). This is a huge con given this (with the beach) was nearly the entire reason we booked here....
-The beds are as soft as concrete. I've never slept on anything harder on my life. At several points I contemplated laying on the tile floor as it might be softer.
-The rooms are recently painted/updated, however, several aspects of the property have clearly not been cared for in some time (outdoor pool, thermal pool, indoor thermal pool, sauna, etc). They all have a film/ring around the water line, the tile inside has a film on it which insinuates you may find yourself on a slip & slide at any second, and generally the finishes are in disrepair.
-This might be a trivial note, as it's also novel and some might find it quaint, but your only access to your room is via a key that has a giant brass ball larger than any marble I've ever seen and heavy enough to weigh down my husbands pants. I understand this might be historic but for heavens sake who wants to tote around a key that could be used as a paper weight in a hurricane all day.
-We had to check out a day early due to a family emergency, and obviously fully expected to pay for the night we did not use as we pre-booked it, however, the hotel still charged us the per-person/per-night city tax for the night we did not stay, which seems very wrong.
-There is no drinking water provided in the room at any point, instead, you must pay 5 euro at the bar to get drinking water. I suppose this is relatively common in Europe, but at resorts like these we've experienced daily drinking water in our rooms much more often than not.

All that to say, we did enjoy our stay. The hotel is very convenient to the port, shopping/restaurants, and Ischia Ponte, the breakfast is great, the staff is friendly and the beach is wonderful. We would, however, stay somewere else if we came back to Ischia, due simply to the pool being un-swimmable (and also no visible attempt to rectify.... they seemed completely unbothered by the fact that the pool was violently green with algae....), and the bed being so hard you could use it as a homes foundation.

Title: My experience was not 5*
Text:
Single room in this hotel terrible. Paint peeling on furniture, bathroom taps green with wear, round bath plaster coming off. 
Made a complaint but not followed up. Because you travel on your own should have same level of comfort as everyone else after all claims to be 5*

Title: What a wonderful holiday!
Text: This hotel is wonderful.  The staff are professional, but warm and friendly and will help with anything.  The hotel room was very comfortable as was the enormous bed and whilst it was very hot outside, the air conditioning ensured that our room was never too hot.  Our balcony was delightful overlooking the sea and we spent time enjoying watching the many yachts and motor launches arriving and departing.  The private beach is well supervised and catering is excellent as it is in the pool (thermal and cool water pools).  There is also an indoor thermal pool but it was not necessary to use this.  The food was outstanding from the breakfast through to the dinner with so much to choose from and the wine list was also excellent.  Such a super place to stay - we will return very soon.

Title: Beautiful hotel
Text: This was a lovely hotel. It was so nice having easy access to the beach area with chairs and umbrellas provided. The staff were all very helpful and friendly! We had a room with a terrace and view of the water which was really nice. I would love to be back!

Title: Ischia, la dolce vita!
Text:
Omg, what can I say?? Can’t speak highly enough of this Ischia icon, Grand hotel punta molino! From when we stepped out the ferry, promptly welcomed by the smart and smiling Ciro on the transfers, to Ciro the concierge( such a charismatic figure and so friendly!) and all the team at the reception , ladies and boys,ever smiling, helpful and knowledgeable. A mention to the GM Antonio Buono, what a gent, he’s a constant presence and reassurance to his team, at the point that the other day he was around the beach asking customers if they wanted any drinks ordered,what a humble guy, he always had a word with everybody by let you feel special,what a professional.
Not forgetting all the lifeguards on the beach from the head Franco to all the rest of the team, the staff at the breakfast and the housekeepers, all amazing. 
Can’t wait to return again soon, 6 star holiday!!!

Enzo and Kate

Title: Lovely Hotel
Text: second time staying at this lovely hotel .Absolutely nothing I can complain about from the joy of having a private beach location so easy to find your way around the area .Unfortunately my husband was taken quite poorly and if it hadn’t have been for the hotel director Antonio B who came to the  with hospital  just don’t know how we would have managed without him because of the language barrier .His team were so kind and caring , and would come back again and again .Though recommend a room with balcony and terrace .

Title: Best hotel experience I can remember
Text:
The stay started with a text from the hotel telling me that they will be at the dock to pick up my family and I. 
As promised two cars were waiting with very friendly and professional drivers. 
Check in was quick and informative.   The staff instead to carried all our luggage to the rooms. 
The rooms are very well appointed bright and clean.  I felt like the staff straighten the room every time we stepped out.
We had a wonderful meal at the restaurant.   Don't miss the food.
The pool and beach are great.   Again the staff was everywhere with towels helping with umbrellas and chairs.  Very friendly. 
We had such a great time we added another day to our trip.  Even though it cost us unreadable train ferry and hotel in Roma. We are going to plan a couple weeks there soon.

Title: A marvellous holiday.
Text:
An outstanding hotel - we stayed a week and it was both luxurious and friendly. Attentive staff, totally professional, helped guests with everything to enjoy their stay, and did so with a smile. Breakfast overlooking the bay of Naples, stunning views, and a menu to delight the senses. Local wine totally gorgeous. Spa & swimming pools, gym, sauna, beauty & health treatments, all of excellent quality. Room seriously comfortable and serviced to pristine standards. 
The hotel grounds are a delight - beautiful layed-out gardens and a short walk to Ischia’s main shopping & restaurant areas. 
A wonderful experience, we felt we had been treated like royalty. Thoroughly deserves its 5 star rating & exceeded our expectations!
A very happy holiday!

Title: magical spot on the island of Ischia
Text:
This resort is a magical spot on the island of Ischia.
A charming hotel, renovated rooms, lush vegetation around, gives a feeling as if you are in the Seychelles, and especially the thermal, outdoor and indoor pools that are the real surprise that the place inspires. Yes, of course, there is also a large outdoor pool, and access to a private beach.
The hotel overlooks the Castello Aragonese, surrounded by beach restaurants (some of which were still closed in May) and within walking distance of Ischia's main street.
Great breakfasts, live music on the weekends, and efficient staff.
The shuttle service from and to the port definitely adds to the feeling of excellent hospitality.
Highly recommended.

Title: Tiny Room
Text:
Certainly the location,beach,staff and breakfast are really lovely. However my single room does not rate 5*. The chipped furniture and old fashioned bathroom need updating. My room does not match the pictures advertised.
No tea,coffee facilities. TV did not have any foreign channels which all hotels in Italy I’d stayed in

Title: Thank you for a lovely honeymoon!
Text:
Punta Molino! Thank you for everything! After much searching among Ischia's wide range of hotels, we finally found Punta Molino Spa and Resort, and we are SO happy about it! We spent a week of our honeymoon at this wonderful hotel. Everything was just perfect - the charming rooms, the friendly, welcoming reception staff, the delicious breakfast with the kind service staff, the warm thermal pools, the comfortable sunbeds and the security with lifeguards... Yes, the list could go on, but especially we want to thank the staff who saw us, took care of us, and always had a smile on their faces. Impressive! You are so kind. Thanks also to the down-to-earth director who paid attention to us guests, always professional, accommodating, and polite. Thank you also for the lovely evening music and our song; O Sole Mio! What a memory! We will definitely come back and look forward to creating more loving memories at Punta Molino! Now we continue our honeymoon towards Rome and then back home to Sweden again! 
Thank you for everything, greetings from Pernilla and Pär!

Title: Great Horel, Great Service
Text:
Lovely hotel with great service and excellent breakfast. From the moment that we got picked up at the ferryport by the hotel staff until we left we felt most welcomed and treated like royals. Especially Ciro went more then an extra mile to make our stay unforgettable. 

I am already looking forward to going back!

Title: 3 - 4 Star Not a 5 Star as Is Advertised
Text:
Situated in a Good locations which is a plus 
Hoping this helps both customers and the hotel 
Hotel could really use some updates and upgrades 
Really Confused on how this is a 5 Star Hotel as it is more like a 3 -4 star hotel in regards to service 
Service is mediocre at best and you must request service or any attention from staff on the grounds to receive help or customer service. 

I reserved one of there top tier suites, water will only get warm and won’t get hot enough to fill the jacuzzi tub , which I understand things do happen. 
The service and fit and finish is definitely NOT what is expected from a 5 Star Rated Hotel 
Best customer service by Far comes from Ciro at the front desk who is very pleasant and has great customer service skills 

I would highly recommend the staff receives customer service training and expectations to ensure a Great customer experience and to keep the customers coming back 

Hope this helps them to increase there customer service for the company and more importantly for the customers to want to come back

Title: Nice hotel, but too quick to charge for ‘extras’
Text: A return to this Ischia hotel after 18 years. It has changed in some ways - less atmospheric perhaps and a tad less friendly - but it retains the wonderful location, the sea vistas from the terrace where meals are served alongside a summer bar with a nightly piano singer and the well appointed rooms. Our sea facing balcony was nicely shaded during the very hot afternoons so well worth the upgrade. Room was comfortable with walk in shower. We were given a nice complimentary Prosecco bottle and fruit on arrival, but water is not free in the room (€5 a bottle) which doesn’t feel right in a 5* hotel; nor does the woefully intermittent Wi-Fi reception. The spa was good, with excellent massages. Breakfasts were decent buffets, but again a tad surprisingly, omelettes attract a €15 surcharge. We had a nice dinner on the terrace our first night, but enjoyed some of the excellent local restaurants other nights. Overall a nice hotel, but it could benefit from a more generous attitude to its guests in the small things.

Title: Everything is there to make you feel  like Italian royalty
Text: The Italians that run this hotel really know to do it,…of course the linens on the bed were soft, pressed  and comfortable, the rooms were big and spacious, and the food was spectacular, and then combining this with an outstanding spa treatment, you’ll feel like royalty …..it’s the total package not to forget to mention  the thermal pool and the private beach right there. The location is wonderful and it’s walking distance to the shops…..if you want a fantastic all around resort to stay …stay at Punto Molina in Ischia and feel like Royalty.

Title: Luxury at it’s finest on the beautiful island of Ischia
Text: I came to this quant jem on the recommendation of my dear friend Salvatore. It is just stunning, my room overlooks the water and the nearby castle. The hotel is directly on a beautiful beach and has a thermal pool. I’m sitting here in the restaurant sipping on a Bellini and enjoying the freshest fish. The staff is very attentive and the service is impeccable. I will be recommending this resort to all of my friends and family .

Title: Superb hotel, so safe and great location
Text:
Loved this place. Staff so nice, location great,  comfy sunbeds and all beautiful.  

Drink prices higher but you pay for the surroundings!

The sea was so warm, beautiful.  Every member of staff so helpful.

Thank you for a lovely stay and your kindness

Title: Gorgeous location and good hotel
Text:
We stayed at this hotel for a week in late June/early July and enjoyed it very. much. The location is spectacular, with a lovely small private beach, beautiful views, great swimming pools, and convenient to walk to the port and the castle, with nice shops and good restaurants close by. Many of the staff were very nice too, including the head waiter.
There were a couple of relatively small things that made our stay good rather than great. The beds were hard and uncomfortable and so were the pillows. On Day 5 of 7, we asked if they could help with this and they gave us mattress toppers and better pillows, which made things a bit better. There was a flashing light on the ceiling (smoke alarm?) which was quite obtrusive and annoying and interrupted sleep. And no matter how early we went down to the beach, the front row of beach chairs were reserved with towels etc. I asked the lifeguard and he said they reserved them for clients. So I'm not sure what is going on there?
On the positive side again, the breakfast buffet was fabulous and delicious, with a good range of appealing options. The restaurant had a lovely view, and we enjoyed eating there, though it was a bit expensive and the vegetarian options were very limited.
Some of the staff were friendlier than others.
All of that said, we enjoyed the traditional atmosphere of the hotel, as well as the location, and would recommend it.

Title: Lots is very good
Text:
Brilliant location. 
Many staff were very friendly and lovely. 
Superb breakfasts although the fresh fruit choice was limited and the overall breakfast selection didn’t alter during our stay. Great scrambled eggs and the best smoked salmon I’ve had in many years. 
Fantastic pools. 
Limited inside bar drink selection. 
Lots of comfy areas to sit in the hotel. 
Unfortunately the very worst packed breakfast on our early checkout day. 2 very dry rolls with a thin filling, bottle of water, some fruit and 2 slices of factory packed toast. No yoghurt, fruit juice or fresh pastries as our previous, lower starred hotel had provided.

Title: A bit tired, but good location
Text:
Definitely a mixed bag here! We stayed for 6 nights in September.

We really liked the outdoor pool - it's deep and refreshing, but really cold, which we personally like, but too cold for other people, I think, given the lack of anyone else in it.

Beach was great (sea was much warmer than the pool), and the outdoor thermal pool was lovely.

However, the staff were a little stand-offish, which didn't really bother us though we were conscious of it, and some information on check in would have been nice - just basics like breakfast times, or pointing us to facilities. Literally got given an key and off we went. 

Room was fine, and loved the sea view with castle in the distance, but be aware that if you're anywhere near the pool/restaurant area, you will hear the hotel singer and piano player every night from 9pm to midnight, even with the windows shut. Fair enough if you like a hotel with entertainment - but if you don't, be warned and take some ear plugs! Or give in and sing along. It all felt a bit dated, honestly.

The indoor spa area was pretty grim - the sauna and steam room were switched off when we were there, but I did have a look at the smell of mould was pretty overwhelming. Certainly not the spa experience we've had in Italy before. And I never saw anyone having any treatments - it was a bit of a ghost town in there.  I wouldn't have had a treatment there.

For the price, we wanted more, but still had a lovely time jumping from sea to pool, and location is great. 

Would I recommend it? If you can get a very good deal, and want a decent base with a beach, then yes. If you are after the 5 star spa experience it promises, then no - try elsewhere.

Title: Highly recommended!
Text: Lovely hotel with a perfect setting.  Our junior suite was well laid out and very spacious. Breakfast was wonderful.  The attention and recommendations from the front desk were excellent.  Always friendly and eager to assist you.  Really loved the various beach areas to relax. Highly recommend.

Title: Really Disappointed
Text: We returned to stay at Punto Molino having stayed here in 2019.  Wow what a difference, it has lost it's charm and appeal.  The service at Breakfast and Dinner in the Restaurant was poor.  The choice of food in the evening just wasn't good enough.  It's such a pity because this hotel has the best view of the Castle.

Title: Wonderful Stay
Text: We had a beautiful room with a balcony  with good AC and comfortable beds.  The room was big  enough with good space to store your belongings.  The hotel is on the sea, so it’s a short walk to sit in a lounge chair and gaze at the nearby castle.  There is a big outdoor pool and a smaller thermal one.  The people who work there are  attentive and kind.  The gym isn’t much though. And dinner, while ok,was our worst meal in Ischia and the most expensive.

Title: Lovely hotel
Text: Had a lovely time in Ischia and at this hotel. Rooms spotlessly clean, excellent food and service at breakfast and dinner. Pretty grounds and nice pool and beach areas. Only negatives for us and hence not a 5 were awful internet and pools need a good clean as green algae on the sides. Would definitely stay here again.

Title: Sensational hotel
Text: Sensational hotel! I don’t know what more to say. Excellent service, food, accommodation and position. Private beach, pool and thermal bath was great. I highly recommend that couples or families looking for great value for money stay here.

Title: 5 Star!
Text: We arrived early before our room was ready. We were shown to the bar and given a complimentary drink and a room to store our bags so we could change and enjoy the amenities. We had originally booked a sea view room but had had to change our booking due to travel restrictions and only a garden view was available. We weren’t disappointed, it was lovely. The only issue we had was the mattresses were hard but when I asked for a mattress topper the hotel obliged ( it actually didn’t make that much difference but they did try to help) The location is perfect, very peaceful but within walking distance of shops and restaurants. The staff were exceptional as was the food. Rooms were cleaned every day and fresh towels delivered if needed, even in the evening, with a turn down service. My only negative point would be that the drinks were very expensive, but you  do have choice, just buy your own and sit on the balcony. We will definitely return to this hotel, and would like to thank Luigi and Salvatore for their exceptional service at breakfast and dinner, as well as the rest of the staff. Thank you for making our delayed honeymoon so special. Joanne & Mark

Title: Perfecto!
Text:
Punta Molino is one of the most wonderful hotels I’ve stayed in!  A complete throwback to the days of grandeur-in the best way possible.  I am very picky about hotels (I love Four Seasons…)-Punta Molino is beautifully done-Superior Old Style Sea view room is gorgeous (nicer than website pics), immaculate, beautiful bathroom, all amenities (body wash, shower caps, etc) great view and balcony-yes, over a roof, which could bother me but view was so amazing it did not detract!  New Style Superior room also looked beautiful.  This is not your typical American hotel (good!)- it is truly an Italian beach resort where you can feel the history of the gorgeous island.  Now, onto the amazing: 1. Shuttle driver, Ciro! We hugged and kissed goodbye.   He was incredible, took such great care of us from pick up to drop off at the ferry  2. Andrea at front desk-so wonderful and accommodating in every way! (our ferry to Sorrento was cancelled 2 days in a row-he moved things around so we could stay, and generally met our every need-we love Andrea!). 3. Ciro the concierge, moved mountains for us to get from Ischia to Sorrento.   Pretty much, every request and need is met with a smile and everyone works hard to
make your stay perfect.   Oh, finally, the hotel beaches (there are several!) and thermal pools are amazing! Views of the castle, easy to swim, lounge, heal in the thermal pool.  As I said, our stay was literally perfecto!   I understand some of the less glowing reviews-(again, it’s not a Four Seasons) but I absolutely loved this beautiful, warm, welcoming hotel.   Run, don’t walk!  I hope to return very soon with my family and friends.

Title: Could Be Better
Text: Hotel staff is wonderful and grounds are beautiful. Convenient location to walk to restaurant and shopping. Breakfast in the morning is good. Unfortunately at midnight they turn off the AC which made it uncomfortable in the heat. Our phone also did not work so we had to walk down to reception for our needs.

Title: A true Italian Gem!
Text: We stayed for 2 nights and wish we stayed another 2 nights! This is truly a grand hotel in every way. Old Italian luxury that is hard to find! Our room and bathroom were large and spacious and beautifully appointed. We had a large balcony overlooking the sea. Our room was immaculate. The staff was very helpful and friendly and have decorum as one would expect at a hotel of this stature. This hotel has two mineral pools to promote health and wellness, and I have to say they really were amazing. The hotel is right on the beach, and has a lovely private beach area. The breakfast is fantastic, and their restaurant is superb!  The location is fantastic as you can walk to the castle, and it is also quiet and out of the hubbub of the busy areas. We can’t wait to return. Don’t pass up this fantastic resort.

Title: Old Fashioned Italian Gem
Text:
We’ve just stayed at this quaint and charming hotel for the past 6 days. The rooms are clean, well equipped and comfortable. Ours had a sea view and looked down on  both pools, including the Thermal pool which was lovely. The staff are very friendly,  attentive and provide good old fashioned service which was a real treat. There is a Spa, beach, indoor pool, bar and restaurant suitable for perhaps those looking for some peace and quiet in a traditional setting - more adult than young children friendly and a great place to stay! 
Thank you again Warren & Amanda - we hope to be back

Title: Lovely hotel but...
Text: I'm left with mixed feelings about Punta Molina as it has a five star rating and was not what I expected.  The hotel and grounds are lovely, spa pools inside and out fabulous, great, fairly extensive private beaches that were never overly busy at the end of September, very nice breakfast.  The reception staff were unfailingly helpful with requests for advice.  Good location with nice restaurants in 15 minute walk - on our first morning we asked to see the restaurant menu but were told we needed to wait for the restaurant manager to arrive so didn't bother.  Less postive was the (small) shower that was either hot or cold, near impossible to maintain a reasonable temperature; cheap, plywood type of sliding door from the bathroom to the bedroom; and wifi was completely dire. Not trying to use any great bandwidth, just emails, reading newspapers on line etc.  Constantly dropped out or froze. Our partial sea view room had a lovely sideways view to the castle and sea but in the foreground was lots of tiled flat roof and directly opposite was a bank of rooms and balconies. Nice facilities but not a five star hotel.

Title: Outstanding
Text:
Loved this hotel.... It's services.. Food etc.. But the view is priceless and ischia is out favorite place! A must place to stay and enjoy the night music over the ocean!
Our room was spectacular... Clean.. Turn down service was so elegant. The staff could not have done more and the water was crystal clear!

Title: Late Summer Break
Text:
A place of calm and efficient service set in private grounds around the small beach with easy walking access to the shops, bars, Port and to San Pietro.

A really very nice place to relax, enjoy the facilities food and stay.

All the staff very courteous and helpful especially Ciro on Front Desk,Giorgio behind the bar and Ciro the taxi driver.

Title: Searching for genuine humanity? This is the right place
Text: I’d just heard about Punta Molino Resort ever since, but finally had the chance to stay there for three days, and I can honestly say that it was a great experience. The location is gorgeous and allows you to reach the main venues in Ischia Porto. The view from every part of the resort is stunning as well as the park that surrounds it. Customers can choose several services such as the gym, the thermal baths, the beaches, the spa, and, of course, the bar and an elegant but not formal restaurant. Everything is so easy that you don’t need any induction to enjoy these services. But what, in my opinion, makes this resort really special and attracts and retains customers is the staff, from the manager to the waiters. I happened to meet people who have been spending their summer holidays for 26 years in a row at Punta Molino Resort, and the main reason of their fidelity is the sincere kindness and humanity of all the people working there, from the eldest to the recent ones. And as a brand new customer, I can confirm this without any doubt.

Title: Ischia Spas and fun!
Text: The Punta Molina hotel was lovely, turning back the clock to a glamorous old Hollywood era. It is hard to find people who speak English but the hotel always had a staff member to provide services and help including hiring a car for us. We ventured to Maronti Beach and climbed to a spa Cavascura. We also spent time in the thermal pool and pool and beach right at our hotel with a stunning view of the Castle. There is not much nightlife but they did have a piano terrace bar. We used the hotel spa for a facial and it was lovely.

Title: Lovely hotel
Text: I think this is this is the best hotel in Ischia. The staff at reception were superb, especially Eleanor and Ceco were so helpful  and couldn’t do enough to help. The hotel was very well run from the service at the beach & pontoons to the restaurant, and you can tell the management know how to look after their guests . Hotel is well worth visiting and will definitely be back.

Title: Classy Place
Text: The location was excellent -situated at the waterfront with spacious gardens. Also it was within walking distance to the castle and the port.  It is not an ultra modern hotel but has lots of character. The bed was very comfortable with good quality bedding and fluffy towels. The food was delicious. We were there 2nd to 9th June and the night before we left dinner moved from the dining room to the patio area. We didn’t have any problem getting a lounger at the beach or the pool and the thermal pool was amazing. This holiday was organised by Citalia and they were first class. No complaints about any aspect of this hotel.

Title: Swimwear
Text:
Excellent hotel all round food very good
But.    We used the out door thermal pool and it completely ruined two pairs of my husbands swimwear and one of my bikinis
There are no signs to warn against this
We were not the only ones who had this problem other guests also had same problem
Has any one else who stayed at this hotel found this
Hotel not helpfull with complaint

Title: A gem of a hotel really
Text:
Stayed here recently for five days and would thoroughly recommend. 
Good rooms , nice staff ,excellent breakfasts and a great private beach all add to make this a special memory for us. 
Location was superb too. Close enough to walk to either the point or port in minutes but also seemed far from the crowds given its “hidden “ location. 
Didn’t use the pool because the sea was far too attractive however it too looked excellent. 

All in all unassuming non glitzy just what we needed. 

We would definitely return.

Title: A Wonderful experience.
Text:
The location of this hotel is amazing , on the beach and close to shops and restaurants, but above all,  the staff are so attentive and helpful with everything.
My second visit and I certainly hope to be back again next year.

Title: Great stay at Punta Molina Resort
Text:
Excellent accommodation and service. Only negative is breakfast is really poor. The private beach whilst easy access has a really rough stone sand and is uncomfortable for walking.
Both Thermal pool and swimming pool are spotless. 
Excellent location for town center and restaurants.

Title: Absolutely beautiful!
Text:
Just returned from six nights at this beautiful hotel. We were upgraded to a suite which was a lovely surprise! As it was our wedding anniversary it felt very special. Service from the reception staff, cleaning staff, pool staff and restaurant staff was superb. A special mention to Salvatore, restaurant manager who was so professional and very funny!!

The spa treatments we had were excellent (massage and facial).

The indoor and outdoor thermal pools are lovely and we had a relaxing experience especially as the weather was not great.

This hotel is in a superb location within walking distance to local shops and bars and to the amazing castle.

Highly recommended. Thank you!

Title: Ivanov
Text: Recommended hot. Evreting here is amazing. The staff are very welcome friendly. Pools is lovely, food on the snacks bar is very delicious. Servis in restorant 5stars,breakfast - evreting and freshly 5stars, the rooms is beautiful and clean, leadis cleaning 2 times a day 5 stars, for the people they work to reception very welcome, helpful and the really spouk 🇷🇺, 🏴󠁧󠁢󠁥󠁮󠁧󠁿, 🇩🇪, 🇫🇷 and 🇮🇹. I really anjoed and I will be back

Title: Illusion of grandeur
Text:
This is clearly one of those places where you either have to be lucky or Italian. 
I booked this hotel very well in advance, in fact as soon as this year’s booking became available, hoping to secure good accommodation. 
We were allocated two smallish rooms on the top floor, south-facing and very uncomfortably hot as the air-conditioning was still switched on to heating. The reception explained that there is a law which does not allow to switch on the cooling before June! It really does not make sense to me as the heating would be as environmentally unsound. 
We had to keep our windows open throughout our stay and did not have a decent night sleep. There was noise and tobacco smoking from outside. The bedding, of the cheap variety, was quite telling as I had to deconstruct the covers to remove the inside blanket to make it less hot. Imagine my surprise when I found there were two blankets arranged lengthwise instead of a single one of a right size. 
The bathroom fittings were outdated and not very efficient. The bath drain and its plug were rusty. The shower was of a cheap nasty plastic type you can buy in a supermarket for a fiver, and the temperature of the shower was almost impossible to control. It was going from cold to boiling hot with a sudden surge. 
These things might appear insignificant, but they add up to create a bad impression. There must be better rooms here, considering all the good reviews, but we were not lucky enough to stay in those. 
After we left, we looked at the bill and saw that we were entitled to spa treatments! No one at the reception mentioned it, or indeed pointed the spa out to us. 
This is not a five-star hotel. 
Very disappointed.

Title: Will be back
Text:
I came here for work and will definitely bring my family back. Was a lovely hotel in a beautiful place on a wonderful island.

We hired scooters and toured the island which was a great way to get around and see the beaches, thermal waters, amazing restaurants and picturesque towns.

Title: 5 stars and deserves each one
Text: We arrived early and I made the reservation for the following day. They kindly switched the day and offered us a drink on gorgeous patio overlooking water for our inconvenience. Location is perfect, 20 minute walk from the ferry and 20 minutes further to the Castello. Right on ocean with multiple small beaches and a warm salt pool and regular swimming pool. Our room was a garden view yet you could see the water and castle. AC worked great. Finally, breakfast was fantastic with full buffet including such touches as peeled Kiwi and soft boiled eggs separated according to 3, 4 or 5 minutes cooked.

Title: Tranquil Vacation in June
Text: My wife and I originally booked for one week in June.  After a few days of this relaxing and tranquil environment, as well as the service by everyone, we extended for an extra week. Management and staff were absolutely keen on making the guests comfortable to the utmost. Our room (in the main hotel) was spacious, had a nice balcony with a sea and castle view which was especially beautiful when lit at nights.  We enjoyed the friendly and efficient service at the Terrazza Dining where we had breakfast and dined at nights with the piano bar lasting until mid-night. Pool and beach attendants ensured our comfort by providing necessary items for lounging. The resort has a large outdoor pool, two thermal pools, a sauna, Turkish sauna, a gym and also a spa. We enjoyed the thermal indoor pool on days when it rained.  Sitting in the gardens with all the flowers in bloom, gazing at the sky added to the ambience at nights. The hotel is in an ideal location, half-way between Ischia Ponte and the Castle Argonnese. Our two-week vacation at this lovely resort was a fantastic experience and we plan to return very soon! Thanks to all at Punta Molino Resort and Spa for a wonderful vacation in Ischia.

Title: Great location, great staff but terrible air conditioning
Text:
Just returned from 9 nights in this hotel in a Superior sea view with balcony room. The room was spacious and clean with views over the roof of the restaurant towards the sea. On arrival they kindly gave us a bottle of sparkling wine and a plate of fruit which is a lovely touch. So thank you for that. There was sufficient wardrobe space, although we did request more hangers and a further 9 hangers arrived promptly.
Happily for me there was a plug for my hairdryer within reach of a mirror (which a common bugbear for me).
My biggest complaint on the room was the air con. The weather was seldom higher than 26 degrees when we were there but the air com was completely inadequate. The room was so hot we didn't get a decent nights sleep for the entire time we were there. We complained to the management and they mumbled something about changing rooms but we didn't want to have to pack and unpack all our things so we asked them to fix it. They said they would but there was little improvement so we just put up with it. We opened the windows most nights and the mosquitos weren't too bad as the weather was not that hot. I dread to think what it would be like in August.
Moving on to other areas; the beach area was great and we had a tremendous service from the beach staff. They saved us two beds every morning on a raised platform overlooking the castle. It was exceptional service, we didn't even have to ask them, they knew we liked that spot and saved it for us every day. They also worked tirelessly to keep us in the shade or out in sun, what ever we wanted. Full marks to them.
We only ate breakfast in the hotel and it was varied and pretty good. Although the egg chef only appeared once in 9 days. There was a good choice of sweet and savoury including smoked salmon and typical cheeses and meats.
The position of the hotel is great, it is almost immediately on the beach, with just a path to cross to reach it. It is about equal distance (roughly 1K ) from both the port and the castle.
Overall this is a very nice clean hotel but I would say it is 4 stars, not five. There were a few little gripes like not leaving fresh shower gel in room (presumably to save money).
The reception staff were very friendly and helpful, they bought our return tickets for the ferry and added them to bill which was very efficient.

Title: lovely hotel
Text: I can't understand the negative reviews on this hotel. we have just returned from a weeks stay here and found it very clean and charming. I would class this a quiet, elegant hotel. The food was fabulous and the staff couldn't do enough for us, but be aware that Ischia is wear the Italians holiday so English is not widely spoken, therefor only a couple of the staff spoke good english  the rest were passable and sometimes confusing. We had a very pleasent stay.

Title: Degrading splendour
Text:
We've been to this hotel two times already and I believe, there will not be a third time.  It is sad to see how the personnel and the quality of service are degrading.  Especially, the restaurant: when all the local shops were full of local fruit, the restaurant offered us canned pears.  Almost no seafood... at a seaside restaurant!  All in all, what might be passable for a 3-star place, appears totally inappropriate for a 5-star Grand hotel that used to boast incomparable service.

Not a disaster, or course, but a complete waste in terms of money vs. quality.

Title: Fantastic Experience.  Would definitely go back to.
Text: This is an all around really great hotel that is really focused on customer service.  The location is great, half way between the port and the castle/monastery that's definitely worth checking out for it's amazing views.  The hotel offers a shuttle to and from the port but on a nice day you can walk either distance and check out the many restaurants in either location.  All front desk staff speak fluent English and are very friendly and helpful in helping you figure out what to do during your stay whether at the hotel, on the island, or if you want to take a trip nearby.  The remaining hotel staff speak at least some basic English so we definitely felt comfortable getting our needs met. The complimentary breakfast was very good with a lot of variety including eggs, salmon, great local cheeses, and delicious pastries, etc.  You can grab a glass of champagne daily with breakfast, but get there on the earlier side because occasionally it doesn't last the entire service.  The wait staff will also bring you coffee or cappuccino to the table.  We were traveling off season so we got upgraded free of charge to a room with a view of the sea and the castle which was a really nice view to wake up to.  The rooms were very clean, great size and very comfortable.  The staff cleaned them multiple times a day and changed our towels.  The complementary toiletries smelled nice but If you have long hair, I recommend bringing conditioner because the shampoo doesn't seem to be a shampoo/conditioner mixture.  The hotel has great outdoor services with a private beach, pool, as well as a thermal pool.  There is always an attendant on duty who hands out towels and helps you get settled.  We decided to chill at the hotel on two different days and found it to be very relaxing and refreshing.  Overall, the stay felt very smooth and easy and we came back home very relaxed.  I definitely want to go back to Ischia because it's a truly amazing island to visit and I would definitely try to stay at this hotel again.  Highly recommended!

Title: Elegant in a previous era, now just tired
Text:
Punta Molino is like your relative who smoked too many cigarettes in the 70s. Perhaps perceived as elegant at the time, but has aged very poorly. 

The rooms are dated, the service is well intentioned but inconsistent, and the facilities have not been maintained to a level you'd expect from a 5 star hotel (rusty tiles around the pool, very shabby indoor pool facilities surrounded by fake plants and flowers). 

While Ischia is lovely, do yourself a favor and book elsewhere.

Title: Old World Italian Charm
Text: We stayed at the Grand Hotel Punta Molino for a week in July . We were made to feel instantly welcome from the moment we arrived . Staff fantastically helpful from reception to life-guards on the beach . Will definitely return. Thanks to everyone who made our stay on Ischia so memorable !

Title: Fantastic in every way!
Text: Stayed here for three nights. The hotel is stunning. The grounds are beautiful, quiet and serene. The room fantastic (thanks for the upgrade to a suite!). The staff was wonderful so helpful in every way. The views are beautiful. You have a choice of pools or beach and a short stroll to town and great restaurants. Fabulous outdoor breakfast. Would highly recommend this jewel and am sorry we couldn't stay longer!

Title: Nice Hotel
Text: The room was spotless and comfortable and we had 2 adults and a 14 year old boy. The location was nice, close to town. The grounds were a bit tired. Staff was wonderful and pleasant. Breakfast was great and a fantastic view. WiFi could use some help.

Title: Disappointing- Not recommended
Text: I stayed at this hotel with my husband for 4 nights. Upon check-in there is no orientation/explanation of the hotel features (pool, breakfast hours, wifi etc) which is pretty standard in any hotel. The wifi only worked in the lobby-- not our room, breakfast area, or pool. The hotel itself is dated. I believe this hotel caters to Italians 55yrs old and older. There was poor service at the pool-- we had to spend 15 minutes each morning finding someone to give us a towel. I booked through the hotel's website which offers "free beach/pool towels only booking on this website"-- Yet, towels were free for everyone. One night, I killed a large roach in our room. Spend your money elsewhere.

Title: VERY GOOD HOTEL. CONVENIENT LOCATION. BEAUTIFUL SERVICE
Text:
VERY GOOD HOTEL. CONVENIENT LOCATION. BEAUTIFUL SERVICE. The staff was wonderfully attentive, not imposing.
A buffet breakfast was served on the terrace and offered all possible variety of products. All products are fresh and delicious and the restaurant service is superb.The room was amazing with a nice balcony and a beautiful view.
The hotel overlooks its own private beach with ample chaise longue, overlooking the neighboring island of Procida and the impressive Castle of Castello Aragones. In the evening, at the piano bar, we had the opportunity to listen to very talented musicians and got a real pleasure from their singing.
In general, the atmosphere was relaxed everywhere, and all the staff were immaculately presented and friendly. We always had help from employees on any questions and advice. Thanks to all the hotel's STAFF for their attention to us. Thanks to them, we had one of the best vacation and we will definitely return to our next summer.
The best recommendations for all.

Title: Great Location!
Text: This property was a pleasant surprise. The view was wonderful and the room was of a high standard. Easy walk to the local restaurants whether you are looking for a pizza or a 4 course meal. The staff was very attentive and accomodating.

Title: LUXURY RELAXATION
Text:
My wife and I arrived at the Grand Punta Molino Hotel in Ischia to be greeted with the news we were being upgraded to a Superior Room.
Having booked for 14 nights, we were shown to the most beautiful room imaginable with a sea view you dream of.
Staff were wonderfully attentive without being intrusive.
Buffet breakfast was served on the terrace (one of our highlights) and offered everything... cereals; yoghurts; fruit juice; bacon; eggs (scrambled/poached/sunny side up); sausages; cold meats; cheeses; croissants; pastries; gateaux; tea/coffee... and even spumante in a flute glass (no extra charge) if the notion takes you.
The exotic Piano Bar featured a female singer and highly talented pianist each evening. Songs were Italian and old time American favourites.
In addition to the outdoor pool was a smaller adjacent heated pool.
The hotel looked out onto it's own private beach with adequate sunbeds offering views of the neighbouring island of Procida and the spectacular Castello Aragonese.
Every beauty treatment imaginable was available in the sauna and spa area.
Overall, the atmosphere was relaxed throughout and all staff were immaculately presented and friendly.
We were made to feel like VIPs.
I would recommend the Punta Molino to anyone... in fact, everyone!

Title: Always a winner!!!!
Text:
This was the 3rd time at this hotel and never left disappointed.
On arrival the room was amazing with a nice terrace and a really relaxing bath tab. The breakfast and dinner were very good and the staff super professional. I would particularly mention a young italian guy ( sorry can't remember his name) he served us at breakfast and dinner and remember that I have a dairy allergy...We will return for sure.

Title: Mr
Text:
The only reason I am writing this review is that we E mailed our concerns to the hotel on returning to the UK and thought that someone  might of replied. This was our 5th time here and I have to say that we were left disappointed this time. On a positive note all the staff are very friendly and helpful. In particular the beach attendants were brilliant. The room we stayed in was very tired. The shower screen is old very stained and water leaked badly onto the floor. We were left a towel with a six inch hole in! Generally though the room was clean. The most disappointing area was the restaurant where the standard of the evening food has gone down hill since our last visit. The 'show night' food which we have always looked forward to was quite frankly awful. The suckling pig was inedible. The chefs serving the food were casually dressed- no chefs uniforms. No pomp and ceremony as previous years. No sense of a special occasion. In fact whilst we were there another British couple walked out without completing their meal. The choice of wine was limited. We wanted a rose of which there was one choice. We tried it and found it so bad returned it. We overheard other clients (at least three ) ordering various wines only to be told they were not available. Even though we feel the standard has slipped we will return next year to see if there has been an improvement. We sincerely hope so because it is a beautiful hotel in a wonderful location.
Regards
RR Taunton

Title: Fabulous location, disappointed with the hotel
Text: Amazing location between Ischia Porto and Ischia Ponte with a stunning little beach and super beach staff. Very disappointed with the 'luxury 5 star' aspect. Wi-FI almost non existent in our room (we'd paid top supplement for sea view - stunning), sadly a tiny balcony which obscured everything except an immediate view. Advertised English TV channels (I know it sounds sad but we like to chill out & watch a film early evening before going out for supper) only two channels CNN & BBC news which were on a repeated cycle. Mini bar didn't get topped up during our stay, turn down service appeared twice at 5.30 while we were showering and so never came back. One night they did turn down the bed but left the door wide open...Most disappointing after being told we could use a room to shower & change before heading home (we were quite happy to have paid a supplement for late check out as our flight was at 9pm). We were shown a cramped changing room amongst the spa area & told to use the communal shower. No mirror, no plug for a hair dryer. After showering we went to reception and I asked to use the room where our bags were stored so I could use a plug, reception were very helpful but housekeeping weren't pleased! £1500+ for 6 nights b & b.... I expect and have relieved better! Won't be returning to this hotel but will try others nearby as we love Ischia.

Title: Punta Molino - Amazing service, food, and location!
Text: This was the first stop for our honeymoon across Italy.  And by far, this was one of our favorite stays.  The hotel staff is accommodating and very helpful with traveling questions, and restaurant recommendations. Staff was even helpful in coordinating ferry trips for us and helping us get to where we needed to be.  We were so happy with how easy they made it for us to get around.  The hotel is also in a great location - less than a 5 minute walk to the shopping / restaurant district and a close 15 min walk to the castle.  Overall, I cant say enough about the quality of the hotel, the staff, and location.  And to seal the deal, the hotel breakfast was by far the best one of the three different hotels we stayed in Italy.

Title: Believe the fabulous reviews!
Text:
This place is wonderful and all the really positive comments about it are true! We flew to Naples and then   Citalia, our tour operator, transferred us by taxi to the port where we went by hydrofoil to Ischia port and then were transferred by taxi to the hotel. It might sound a bit of a rigmarole but was actually very straightforward. 

We received a very warm welcome from Ciro at Reception and were told that we had been upgraded. I'm not sure what we had done to deserve this, we certainly didn't ask for an upgrade but we were really delighted to be given a Junior Suite. The best thing about the suite was the extra large balcony which meant we had a 180 degree  view of the sea, including the spectacular Aragonese castle. To be honest though, providing you have a view of the sea, I should imagine that  all the rooms are lovely. 

Some of the comments here aren't overly positive about the food of an evening. I've no idea why. It, and the restaurant service are superb. You can choose what you wish for your Hors d'Oeuvre from a buffet; there is plenty to choose from, including a large selection of salads and cold meats, so you would have to be incredibly fussy not to find something you like. The following two courses are a la Carte and then there is a dessert buffet selection, or ice cream, or a large selection of local cheeses. Breakfast is excellent too. My husband cannot eat gluten and the restaurant staff couldn't have been more helpful: they were fantastic, they really were. 

The rooms, like the rest of the hotel are spotless. I had the impression that the staff really care about the hotel. There are three pools; two thermae pools (one inside) and one outside and an unheated pool. I didn't venture into the unheated pool but was told it was pretty cold! However, it seemed that most people swan in the sea, or used the thermae pools. One word of advice; take some old swimwear for the thermae pools. The natural minerals stain your swimwear. I've washed the swimwear we wore twice now that I'm home and the staining hasn't totally come out. The minerals also stick to your skin a little- I had a bit of a shock the first time I used the pool, showered and then rubbed myself dry. The towel looked as those I'd been using fake tan! That said, the condition of my skin is now fantastic. It doesn't seem to affect your hair though, or at least it didn't mine. There is a changing cubical by the pools and so it's very easy to change from your sunbathing costume to an old one that you're not so fussed about! 

It's easy to walk into town from the hotel and the Castle is only about 1.5 mile walk away. Wear flat shoes if you intend to walk up there,there are an awful lot of steps but it's really worthwhile. The gardens and the various chapels are lovely. 

When we stayed there were mainly Italian, German and Russian guests. However, it probably just depends when you visit. I really do recommend the hotel: incidentally both our taxi drivers told us that it's the best hotel on the island!

Title: ISCHIA, WHAT ELSE?
Text: G.H. Punta Molino might be a bit outdated, if you wish but... the position is simply fantastic by the seaside with a lovely park. SPA is very well manned by Mrs Maria, and if you are going for your mud treatments, Mrs Antonietta is "THE" name! Obviously one of the best therapist I have ever met in my life (and being an ex-athlete I know what it means!) is Dr. William Esposito. Everybody speaks excellent English. Some of the rooms are "old style" but the service is excellent. Fantastic breakfast, excellent "By the Beach" bar with snacks. I would go out for dinner... this is the only point. But on top of it, I loved this place and I have been there on my own, with my husband and with friends.Do not forget the beach, pontoon and pool services mastered by Mr Franco who has a smile on his face from early morning till evening and always available!  Fantastic place and nice Staff.

Title: Amazingly awesome!!! Paradise on Earth
Text:
We stayed in this beautiful hotel on a beautiful island of Ischia for the first time few weeks ago. This was an incredible, very relaxing and the most romantic vacation my wife and I had in years. The hotel is a gem - clean, with a direct access to the beach, tasty and health-conscientious local food selection. The staff was superb - professional, courteous, extremely helpful. The owner was on premises all the time, and made us all feel like at home with his innate friendliness and hospitality. The beach was amazing, with a water that cannot be described but must be experienced.
And the entire island is beautiful - typical picturesque Mediterranean resort.

We are coming back next year with parents, children and friends. Will definitely stay at Punta Molina.

Thank you for making our vacation so memorable

Title: Summer holiday 2016
Text: Lovely rooms with nice beds. Room was large enough for 3 persons. Clean and modern rooms. Wifi was not so good in the room. Nice pool-area and beach. Helpful staff members. Ischia was a lovely place to visit.

Title: Wonderfully relaxing
Text: We have just spent nine days in a superior sea facing room and enjoyed the most wonderful holiday. Everyone who works there tried so hard to ensure that we had a lovely holiday, so thank you to the whole team. The views, room, food, and thermal pool were great. Unusually, there was no busy road in front of the hotel so it was quiet and traffic free. We especially enjoyed being able to walk straight to the small beach and bathing area to swim in the warm sea. Sun beds and towels were plentiful and always ready for us. If you have a massage ask for William, it was excellent. We shall return.

Title: Well-deserved paradise
Text: Great view from the room, sea-view plus parkview. Nice and helpful staff, clean areas, whatever we asked from the reception we get everything immediately. Breakfast is nice. Hotel has it's own beach, with awesome position and view. Thermal pool is the best in area. Overall we are super-satisfied and will be back next year...for the 4th time.

Title: Summer holiday 2016
Text:
just spent 9 night at Punto Molino - it was lovely :) great location, amazing staff.
there are a few areas to improve: slow internet, had a hard time to connect, the beach area needs a good refurbishment.

Title: Over rated
Text:
Location is great. Facilities are average with some shortcomings. Gym is small - no bigger than a hotel room- and in un- air conditioned  area.  How likely is it to get use when it's 100 degrees ?  I would suggest the only reason they plunked one in there at all is to try and achieve a 5 * status. 
Air conditioning in the room - can't bring room temp below high 70's.  
Room itself ( ours was sea view ) is comfortable. Don't mistake sea view with ocean front.  I can see the water - past some buildings. 

Pool staff friendly. As is breakfast staff and breakfast itself was well presented. 

Front desk staff over worked I think.  Not unfriendly - but happy to ignore you if you walk by.  

Over all, it's a reach to call this a 5 star.

Title: Flawless.
Text: Just returned from a 6 night stay from the Punto Molino. It was just perfect. It ticks all the boxes for everything you need , pool area superb , rooms clean and very charming. Views from hotel second to none. Ideal location just a few minutes walk from the  centre ..The standout aspect has to be the staff, nothing was too much trouble. From Ciro the day concierge  (I hope I have name right ) to all reception staff to Salvatore at breakfast and the excellent and so lovely pool staff , they are a credit to the hotel and are the reason I will be returning & also recommending to some more Irish friends. I work in a hotel myself and know the demands of dealing with people but the staff of this hotel are top notch and made us feel so welcome. Thank you Punto Molina for being part of the reason we had the most magical time in the beautiful island of ischia...

Title: Fab hotel, location and service
Text:
Our best ever holiday. Staff are truly amazing. Both Ciros!! And a fab barman as well. I love Italy so much and it's mainly down to the Italian people, how warm and welcoming.
Our room was fabulous. Great pool, great beaches/bathing areas. Pool attendants were so lovely. It's an old, classic hotel which oozes charm and memories. Great location. Would definitely return. We had a 5 year old who loved the hotel. He was like a fish in the pool and the beach. We had a great, family bonding holiday.
Only thing that could be improved would have to be the selection for breakfast. Not too bad in quality, but just not great selection.
We have been on holidays in Capri, Positano, Sorrento, Praiano and Northern Italy and this island is by far our favourite!!
Loved it!!

Title: Fabulous
Text:
We really could not fault anything about this hotel. It was beautifully decorated with exquisite old furniture and Italianate tiles. The staff couldn't have done more for us and service at every meal was outstanding.  The food was delicious with an excellent choice of wines both local and otherwise.  Our room was clean, comfortable and well appointed and always cleaned early in the day.
The Pool area was kept clean and tidy and someone was always on hand to get you anything you wanted.  We will definitely return and soon.  We just loved it.  Keep up the good work

Title: Amazing 5 Star!!
Text: Splurged a little to stay here with my Fiance in Late May. This hotel was fantastic and the staff was so nice! rooms were very clean and comfortable. Unfortunately, we got bad weather while we were there and the beaches were all closed. Didn't know that the beaches didn't open until June. It was very quiet. Spent a lot of time at the indoor salt pool which was amazing. Walked around in our robes and slippers to head down to breakfast and the pool. Breakfast was amazing. So much to choose from and you cant beat that view. This hotel is in walking distance to downtown and the port. We will definitely be coming back soon!

Title: Good hotel
Text: My husband and I stayed here from 3rd June to 9th June.  It is a lovely hotel rooms are a bit small but very well kept and the staff work so hard they canot do enough for you. My only complaint was that the evening meal in the Restaurant needs to be a bit more relaxed and the food really is hit and miss. Overall a lovely holiday. The shops at the port are very good.

Title: A truly wondrous hotel
Text:
From beginning to end, my stay at the Grand Hotel Punta Molino was a truly joyous occasion. All the staff were exceptionally helpful and friendly. The hotel is in an idyllic setting with stunning views of the bay of Naples, Aragonese Castle and delightful gardens. 

The restaurant was outstandingly great. Breakfast on the terrace was truly enjoyable.

Ischia is an exceptional place for a relaxing break, and when I visit in the future, this hotel shall definitely be my choice of stay.

Title: What more could you ask for
Text:
We have just returned from a fabulous week at the Punta Molino, Ischia. What a wonderful hotel. The location of this hotel is beautiful. The food is excellent what a choice!!  The beach and sea are just perfect. Pool areas are excellent. The hotel grounds are a delight, beautiful gardens surround the hotel with a lovely array of beautiful flowerbeds. 
All the staff at this hotel are second to none. nothing is a problem.  Ciro, Andrea, Valeria, Katrina are wonderful so helpful. 
We had a lovely room on the third floor, with a balcony and view of the castle it was lovely and a side view of the sea.  
The room was spotless and the staff who looked after our room were excellent. 
The hotel is just a short walk from the main shopping area and port.
Ischia is a wonderful island and we cant wait to return to the island and off course the Punta Molino.

Title: Best in Town
Text:
We have just returned from a 3 night stay. Only complaint-it was too short! As our cab driver said when we arrived, 'it is the best in town'. We had a really nice room on the first floor, big enough and with a large comfy bed, garden facing. The benefit of this and being half a mile out of town was that it was lovely and quiet. Be aware, however that by law (so I am told) the air conditioning cannot be switched on until the second week in May.
The hotel is very well situated between the Port and the Old Town, with plenty of bars and restaurants, if you must. The staff were really friendly and the food was excellent, to the extent that after only 3 days I am now on a diet. 
The common areas were beautifully furnished and immaculate, with the facilities well up to standard. Would I go back? Yes, like a shot but I would stay a bit longer. It's a long way to go for 3 days, but if you are already in Italy, it is well worth it. If not, best make it at least a week.

Title: "What More Could you Want"
Text: The hotel is a unique style with its curved facade and set in magnificent lush gardens and within easy walking distance of the main shopping street that runs all the way down to the ferry terminal. The interior of the hotel is just majestic and beautiful appointed. There are lovely areas that you can get away in peace and quiet and relax when you have finished with your swim. There are two pools, one of which is a mineral pool. The hotel has its own private beach and wharf. Towels are provided and laid out for you by the staff on your sun lounge. A raised deck/terrace has the outdoor bar area and restaurant. The buffet style breakfast served here was sensational plus the view looking out on the Bay of Naples while enjoying the feast was to die for. My room had a balcony and water view but was unfortunately positioned so that the people in the restaurant could look in. The room was a reasonable size and well appointed. There is an elevator to the upper floors. Free WiFi was supplied. I found the staff to be extremely helpful and attentive but some struggled with English. It is certainly a five star Italian hotel. I stayed three nights and I would definitely stay here again.

Title: Amazing
Text: This was a delayed honeymoon for us, and we were not disappointed!  The room was clean and comfortable,  although would have liked a Seaview.  The saffron were excellent,  they speak excellent  English.  We were the only British  couple there! The food was excellent, the location and amenities great

Title: Wonderful pool and outdoor bar space
Text: The common areas of the hotel are beautiful.  I was upgraded to an oceanview room.  The breakfast that was included was wonderful and served on the outdoor terrace.  There was easy access to the town, not a far walk from the main drag and easy cab ride to great restaurants.

Title: Not worth the 5 stars
Text:
Our overriding memory of the hotel was the aloof and unfriendly attitude of the hotel staff.
I had informed the management that on the Friday it was my wife's 50th birthday and we would be eating in. When we came down to dinner they said we had not booked and made a fuss about the whole thing. 
If I was management I would have made every effort to accommodate my guests especially on a special occasion. That was the reason for our trip.

Title: A Grand Hotel indeed
Text: The best things about this grand hotel are the service, which is second to none, the meals, which are second to very very few whether in terms of quality or quantity, and its glorious position, right on the edge of the sea yet within a short walk of Ischia Porto and Ischia Ponte and with lovely views across the bay to Castello Aragonese, Capri and Sorrento. We stayed for four nights and were struck by the number of Italians who were quite evidently regular patrons, greeting others of like mind who had become their friends over the course of the years, as indeed had many members of the staff who were plainly of longstanding. The rooms were pleasant, and clean, if unspectacular, and the communal areas comfortable if a little dated. But a stay in this rather traditional hotel is a stay made by its staff, from the reception staff (who procured us a rental car at short notice against all the odds), to our head waiter and his team (with whom we enjoyed regular repartee) to the bagnini (who always found us deck chairs in a spot to our liking notwithstanding the various challenges which this task presented) and the charming pianist who tinkled the ivories while we enjoyed evening cocktails at sunset (and mucked in clearing the decks when the storms came in). Not everything about this hotel is five-star, but its  people most certainly are, and it is they that make this a grand hotel in which to stay.

Title: A beutiful hotel
Text: This hotel was one that we had visited as wedding guests we were there for 8 hours or more the reception included a sit down meal and a buffet both types of meal were impeccable sea food sword fish risotto all were amazing the staff were working hard everything was so clean the hotel lays on the beach a stunning view of the castle the interior of the hotel is stunning this hotel is a must stay

Title: Definitely the best
Text:
Visited almost every hotel in. Ischia Port and this was probably the best with the most professional staff. None of the others lived up to a 5* or even 4* rating or anywhere near.  

The room that we had was a good size, very comfortable beds with a lovely balcony overlooking the castle. The hotel was quite old fashioned like most of them on Ischia however it was clean , traditional and with good service and we were very pleased with our choice.

The location was good. Half way between the port and the castle so within about 10 minutes each way. It was also in a quiet location overlooking the sea.  For those who like swimming  or want a cooling off from the heat be warned, almost all the swimming pools on ISchia are thermal and so warm water and therefore not suitable for swimming. Punta Molina offered a good sized pool which was COOL and so  was great for me as I enjoy swimming my 40 lengths every day. It was also a good size. There is also a separate small thermal pool too.  Many other hotels had tiny pools too.

Breakfast  was ok but nothing special. We had a couple of good light lunches by the pool though.

Initially,  I went onto booking.com and hotels.com and the prices were much lower than when I asked the hotels the best price that they could offer ( the day before). Even when I told them this they said that they couldn't offer the same price as booking.com despite the fact that they would be paying between 15 and 18% commission. Seems ridiculous especially at such last minute. The only hotel that was polite and understood my frustration was a lovely young man called Andrea at PUnta Molina.. He showed initiative, understanding and was very professional and tried to match the price as best he could with an upgrade. The rooms division manager and the concierge were also very helpful , friendly and professional and it was on this basis that we chose this hotel above the Excelsior , Miramare or the Moresco.  The reception staff are a credit to this hotel unlike any of the others

Title: I like it !
Text: My friends visit this hotel regularly and this September we went together. I liked the hotel from the first glance: nice location, nice views. Extremelly friendly personnel!!! Cuisine is excellent! My room was on the 4 floor with perfect sew view! Good beach! But this hotel is for those who is looking for quiet and relaxed holidays - you can enjoy your breakfast on a terrace, then relax on a beach, a short walk around town before dinner, and quiet evenings with soft music in the bar or terrace. What else is needed to forget about city life for a week or two? And will say once again - that it is the people working there who make you happy during the stay! My big thank you to all in Punta Molino!

Title: Very old hotel- 3 star maximum!
Text:
We stayed in the hotel in August 2014: the hotel is very old (50years) without major renewal which you can feel everywhere. It is by far not 5 star-> 2-3* maximum.
1) Conditioner was not working well- so it was VERY hot at night
2) Rooms look and feel is very old (not only old fashioned but simply old!) which you can smell and see. Wardrobes are difficult to open with stains inside and they smell old wet wood- so becomes your cloth ;(
3) No one helped to take our luggage to the taxi- they even didn't look our side when we were leaving 
4) there was no normal hair dryer at the hotel- they explained it because of old electric system which can break down if they use powerful electrics ;) (I have long hair and it is critical for me not to spend 1 hour blow drying)
5) with all the above they charge as a luxury 5*-> 500€ per night! 

Yet, to say something good about Punto- nice SPA with friendly people and thermal pool... 

Now we are in St Caterina in Amalfi--> it is like heaven after Punto Molino!

Title: Punta Molino Paradise!
Text: This hotel has the best staff on the planet....fantastic views of the Mediterranean Sea, 3 pools, work-out area, great food, and a spa with thermal water that is second to none!   The owner, Eugenio goes out of his way to make sure  you have the time of your life in Ischia!   I'll be going back the Punta Molino for sure!!!

Title: LOVELY HOTEL IN WONDERFUL LOCATION
Text: Our first time on Ischia, we were delighted with both the picturesque island and the location of the hotel.  The reception staff are extremely pleasant, welcoming and helpful.  Our room was a double room with garden view, furnished in traditional Italian style and spotlessly clean.  (However, the view of the garden was somewhat limited).  The buffet breakfast is typically continental with something for everyone. Dinner is  served at your table with a buffet appetiser and dessert option - the food is excellent and the restaurant staff are all very friendly and attentive.  The guests were a mix of mainly Italians and Germans with some Brits and Russians, mostly over 50. Having stayed in other 5* hotels we would describe the Punta Molino as an excellent 4* hotel and would happily recommend it to others.  We are surprised at some of the negative comments we have read.

Title: Superb Hotel - can't wait to visit again
Text:
We visited the Hotel Punto Molino in August 2013 as part of a trip to celebrate our wedding anniversary.  From the moment we arrived at the Punto Molino we were very well looked after by friendly and attentive staff.  We booked half board with the hotel and the dinner's were amazing.  Each night you get to choose from a buffet (which varies each night) and then you choose a starter and main course.  Desert is also selected from the buffet and the quality and choice of food was great.  We were given a special table for our first night to celebrate our anniversary.  The breakfast buffet was also very good.  
Another very good thing about this hotel is the thermal pool.  We sat in a warm thermal pool whilst it rained around us (the only rain of our holiday).  The bar at the hotel do excellent cocktails and the Don Rosario was particularly good (mixture of prosecco and limoncello).
We are looking forward to visiting this hotel again when we next return to Italy.

Title: Great stay, lacked romance
Text:
We stayed here on honeymoon. We were upgraded on arrival to a sea view room - small, but clean, no bath - by a staff team who were hugely knowledgable, friendly and helpful throughout our stay. The punta molino is a great location as you are a short walk from ischia ponte and the stunning monastery - which you can admire from the hotel's private beach/jetty - and a slightly longer walk to the Porto with its shops and bars.

The hotel was nice enough, with a generous breakfast and lovely views from the terrace, but lacked the romantic sparkle that you'd expect from a five star hotel.  The crowd when we stayed were mostly older couples and families with adult children, largely central and eastern european. Loungers on the hotel's beach were often reserved by 8 am, but a word with the beach attendants usually sorted you something to lie on.  Great coffee.  We didn't eat in the restaurant other than bar meals, which were nice, if not terribly authentic Italian!  The thermal pool was nice, spa and gym facilites a little dated but serviceable.

In all, a good stay in a great location with lovely staff, but just lacking that little something special.

Title: False Advertising
Text:
I booked this hotel thinking it would be 5 days of luxury in the middle of our trip to the Amalfi Coast. I couldn't have been more wrong. 

I took a lot of time looking online at hotels for this stay and picked this one because I thought it looked the best. It said somewhere that it was part of the Leading Hotels of the World group and I know they are really good. It later transpired they are not part of that group at all, even though it's all over the stationery etc. in the room. 

We arrived and the staff watched us struggle with our bags and didn't offer at any point to help us with them. When we got to the room I cried. I had paid extra for a sea view and our view was of a rusty roof and a speck of blue in the distance. The room had not been decorated since the 80s. The paint work was scuffed up, the lampshades by the bed were stained with big brown patches, the bathroom had mould and the panel you push to flush the toilet was so dirty I didn't want to touch it. It wasn't the modern room I had seen online and agreed to pay nearly £300 per night for. I would have been disappointed if I'd paid £70.

I went downstairs and complained and the manager laughed at me and said the hotel was full there was nothing he could do. I was upset, depressed and livid. I said it wasn't what I booked, it wasn't like the modern pictures on the website. The manager said because I had booked last minute we didn't get one of the newly modernised rooms. I said I booked in July for the end of September. Then he admitted they have only decorated 2 rooms. 

Because it's a small Island and hotel rooms are booked up way in advance we had no choice but to stay there. It was at this point we realised they had taken the Leading Hotels tag off the website but it was on everything in the room. 

My boyfriend went and complained again and we were told that we would be "upgraded" on our second night as a room would be free by then. Indeed we did move rooms for our second night but it wasn't really an upgrade. It was a bigger room but the paint was peeling and it was in much the same state as the first room. We did have a view of the sea but we also had the restaurant right below our window, so lots of noise at all hours of the day and night, including the piano man late into the night. It was like a weird take on a luxury hotel from 35 years ago. I couldn't have been more disappointed. 

I was so angry I had to stay here anyway because everywhere else was full. The bit of our holiday that was supposed to be a total treat was the worst bit. Even the pool was peeling on the bottom. 

The only good thing I have to say about it is that the breakfast was nice.

All I can say is: DO NOT BOOK THIS HOTEL IF YOU ARE EXPECTING 5 stars - it's not, it's not even 3.

Title: Beautiful spot spoilt by piano bar going on till 00.15 every night
Text:
This is a fabulous spot, but if you have a seaview - beware. The 'pianoman' plays way too loud beyond midnight. I am a musician myself, the amp is far too high. Don't expect to sleep before 00.30. Manager didn't want to know when I asked to make it quieter. Spoilt the visit for me. 
Selfish musician.

Title: Fabulous stay
Text: What a great hotel!!! It's the perfect place for holidays. The beach and the sea are just perfect. The restaurant at the hotel is simply the best in Ischia. The staff is no nice like a big family. One of the best hotel I have even seen. I really recommend this wonderful five stars hotel.

Title: Take care when choosing Grand Hotel Punta Molino Terme in Ischia, Italy for a vacation!
Text:
We couldn’t help wondering what makes a luxury hotel after our deceiving experience at the Grand Hotel Punta Molino Terme in Ischia, Italy.

We had booked a junior suite and a double room from July 26th to August 1st, 2013, based on the photos the hotel listed on booking.com, yet we used a travel agent. As we arrived late on Friday, July 26th, the so-called junior suite provided to us was no bigger than a double deluxe room in a normal 5-star hotel and a little bigger than the double room in their hotel (although it cost 200 euro more per night)! More than that, the junior suite was placed right on the restaurant terrace which proved noisy and full of aromatic odors. When we decided to leave the very evening we had arrived, they said we will not get any refund as the package was fully paid in advance! Nevertheless, they promised to change our junior suite with the best and largest junior suite which they called new style with no additional cost from Monday, July 29th which they did. Maybe our initial reservation had been given to someone else for the weekend right before we arrived, the hotel being fully booked over that weekend!

During our discussions the personnel proved unprofessional being sometimes rough and impolite. We asked for a taxi, they said 5 minutes’ wait and 15 minutes later when we asked again about our taxi they needed to call another which took 15 more minutes. We were under the impression that they had their “regular” taxi driver and that he needed more time.
