They front desk clerks only provide the information they want or they have an interest in: for example they only present the schedule of a part of the transfer boats to Naples of Capri.

Transfer from Naples Airport to the hotel was way below 5-star expectations, it took longer that the estimates they provided by them before booking. We gave up the return transfer! 

Prior to our arrival we had booked Spa procedures each day starting from 27.07.2013 between 12,00 and 14,00 all 3 clients together till 01.08.2013, except on Sunday when the Spa was closed. When we got there, the Spa knew nothing about our appointments. We gave it up and fully enjoyed the Poseidon garden, spa and pools. 

Inside the rooms towels are old and deteriorated. Hair blowers are out of date and really unusable (out of the 4 rooms we changed, 2 had this problem!). 

The lounge chairs by the pool are insufficient for the hotel capacity and the towels they provide for pool and beach are ragged and discoloured. It is really difficult to find one of the 3 persons dealing with towels by the pool and beach: we had to address the Spa to phone for them after waiting for an hour!

Cuisine is fine although not diversified and nothing is offered! 

There is no room service after mid-night. Once, we asked for 2 bottles of water and 3 glasses and the reception clerk himself came to the room holding in hand the bottles and 3 plastic glasses!

Although the hotel presentation on channel 15 and the promotional materials in the room state they are part of the Leading Hotels of the World, they admit to be out of the network for some time.

Title: Grand Hotel Punta Molino
Text:
Myself and my family had a wonderful holiday at the Grand Hotel Punta Molino, in Italy. The hotel and rooms were of a high standard. The concierge and staff were most helpful at all times, the restaurant and food were delightful.  I must add that the facilities for sunbathing were more than adequate providing clean towels each day for the sun beds and once again the staff in attendance were very helpful. There was a good variety of shops and restaurants within a 5 minute walk from the hotel. I would have no hesitation of returning for a second visit which is certainly going to be on our agenda. 

I thank Just The Ticket for arranging a superb holiday who went to great lengths to make sure our requirements were catered for in every respect. I would most definitely recommend their services and advice, their contact details are as follows: Just The Ticket, Marylebone Street, London. Tel: 0207 291 8118

Title: Ischia June 2013
Text: Went to Ischia for the first time this year. Brilliant location and lovely stuff. However food wasn't  upto 5 star standard, particularly dinner. Unfortunately our room neighbour was a smoker so teh whole room stink of cigaretes, otherwise will def recommend it to my friends and we are plannign to come back next year.

Title: Excellent....
Text:
Wonderful spot, with amazing views.  Food has always been good, although this time, it was very evident that there was a new chef. Still good, but some aspects not as good.

All of the staff are excellent - restaurant staff, front of house, and housekeeping. Pool people are second to non. 

Realise that the hotel will be a little quiet for some people, but it suits me!

Title: Perfect
Text: Celebrated my cousin’s wedding at this great hotel on the 4 August, 2012.  Coming from Sydney (Australia) I found the service excellent with abundance and delicious food and of course, spectacular views.  I compliment the staff for making us feel very welcomed.

Title: Disappointing
Text: Just returned from punta molino and feel very disappointed, we booked a garden villa which we thought would provide privacy, however don't be misled by website pictures. The room we were given had no terrace just a tiny balcony which was overlooked by everyone staying in the hotel. When asked if another room was available was told no they were all booked, however the villa in the same block with a large terrace was unoccupied our whole stay. The average age of guests is 60-70 so if you are much younger please be aware of this. The sunbeds are also an issue which the management do not seem to help or support you with if you have difficulty in finding a sunbed. Guests reserve their beds with the beach attendants and whetther these are being used or not they refuse to let you have one. The only ones they will give you are the ones that are shaded from lunch time in spots no one else wants. Certainly not a 5 star hotel, perhaps location is worth 5 stars but rooms and food is certainly not.

Title: Fantastic location and services
Text: I spent 10 days in the Hotel Punta Molino with my family. This has been a perfect holiday. The hotel is based on one of the most beautiful island in the world. The hotel facilities are outstanding. You get the beach, the spa , the food and an excellent service. Very efficient with a touch of Italian kindness.

Title: Not up to standard
Text: Expectations are high for a hotel claiming to be a 'Leading Hotel of the World' and standards fell well short. Pool are was small with lots of steps to go and order a drink as no poolside service. Beach was grey and full of pebbles but eh beach bar was efficient, friendly and reasonably priced. Rooms comfortable but small. The place needs a complete renovation .

Title: Hidden gem on a magical island.... plus a perfect location for our wedding!
Text:
If you are considering a visit to the beautiful island of Ischia and looking for somewhere to stay then look no further... 

The hotel is situated in a perfect location, with wonderful sea views and the famous castle in the backdrop. The food is always (and I mean always) superb and the wonderful service has brought us back time and time again (for over 14 years!). My family and I see the same faces of both the customers and the staff year after year, which only highlights how magical this place really is.  

We were lucky enough to get married here in 2011. One of the many reasons for choosing Ischia was because of the Punta Molino and they didn't disappoint. We were overwhelmed with how special they made our day - the food and personal touch was out of this world the 100 guests were able to share our best kept secret. I think its safe to say that quite a few more people fell in love with Ischia and the Punta Molino last year and have booked return trips for 2012! 

This really is a special place and it holds many wonderful memories we will always cherish.

James & Nina

Title: Friendly staff and great food
Text:
The best aspects of this hotel are the friendly staff, the great menus at dinner and the hotel facilities including the pools, beach and gardens.
Book a room with a sea view and balcony. I was in room 215 and although the view was not completely uninterrupted, we could see the sea and the balcony was pleasant to sit on, particularly when some amazing fireworks were let off as part of a festival. Absolutely brilliant.
The rooms were immaculate, the twin beds comfortable and every night we received a turn down service with chocolates left on our pillows. Robes and slippers were also provided.
Great bathroom with plenty of hot water at a good pressure. 
The breakfast was served in an open air dining area with an overhead sunscreen and was extensive - breads, toast, boiled eggs, scrambled eggs, bacon, sausage, fresh fruit, melon, yoghurt, actimel, cold meats, cheese, cereal, fruit juices, water and even Prosecco - and the waiters will ask you what coffee you want so you can choose an espresso or capuccino rather than get served a bland generic tourist coffee. The breakfast was also served from 8am to 10.30am which was very relaxing.
The hotel grounds are immaculate and one night we had a gala dinner with champagne and drinks served in the garden before an amazing dinner with numerous courses. Most people dress for dinner and the gala dinner asks for 'a touch of elegance' although there were some gents who turned up in jeans and polo shirts.
The food really is five star here and I am always cautious when booking half board, but wow, what a selection and great quality. The wine list only has Italian wines which is understandable and there are some rather nice Ischian wines available. Most evenings there was some sort of entertainment ie a pianist or singer. We didn't hang around for this but many people did.
The hotel clientele were mainly German and Russians and aged 50-plus and up to late 70s and most of them were very well fed to put it politely, so ladies, please don't worry about going on any crash diet to look good on the poolside or beach. No-one cares and you can relax. There were two pre-school children at the hotel when we were there, who were very well behaved, but there isn't much for children to do apart from use the pool and the beach, although it is packed with loungers and is not a swathe of golden sand.
The main pool was empty most of the time and the mineral pool was also used very little but it is amazing. It is about 36 degrees and there are lots of bubbling jets if you push the buttons on the poolside. It's great using this pool then taking a dip in the swimming pool.
We never had a problem getting a lounger but we did stay at the hotel from September 5 and it wasn't too busy.
The beach is also pleasant with a toilet, changing facilities and a shower room. At first it appears that people have reserved loungers by putting books and magazines on them, but it was the hotel beach attendant who does this. I am not sure why. We always got a lounger. Choose the ones away from the sea front as these can get wet when big ships pass by sending waves crashing against the sea wall.
We took snorkels and there is a bit of sea life to watch. On the beach is a little cafe called Cristinas and although it looks basic, it serves some smashing traditional food at a fraction of the cost of the hotel.
We had some great calimari, bruschetta and beer of course. Great coffee too. They are also very friendly.
We didn't use the health spa but I did pop into the gym where the indoor swimming pool is. It's very, very hot in the gym area which is separated from the pool with screens. There is a cross trainer, treadmill and bike and weight machine. The machines are pretty primitive, but you can get an hour of calorie burning in before tucking into a great evening meal. The gym and pool facilities are free and clean towels and a free water machine is available in the gym. There are no staff manning the gym, you just help yourself which is nice.
The hotel is a pleasant ten minute walk into the main shopping/restaurant area on typical cobbled streets. There is a road along the seafront which is good for running, although it is very hot and quite humid so a walk or jog is best done in the evening.
The castle is about a 25 minute walk but this is also pleasant. The island is busy, bustling and the people very friendly.
The hotel staff are very helpful and nothing is too much trouble. We made our own way to the hotel from Naples airport and on the way home we asked the concierge to organise it for us which was done efficiently. A taxi took us to the port in Ischia, our ferry tickets were organised and our luggage placed on the ferry. A limo collected us at the port in Naples and took us to the airport for just 55 Euros each, not much more than using public transport and organising it yourself.
I can't praise the staff enough who are so friendly and kind without being intrusive. There is also a small library of books in the reception area and ask the concierge for wi-fi access which is free while you stay and he/she will issue with a code to log in.
I would return to this hotel and this lovely island which has so much to offer and fewer tourists than the Amalfi coast and other parts of Italy.

Title: Good, but not 5* Grand
Text: The Molino is positioned close to the beach with stunning views towards prochida and the Aragonese Castle. The hotel is very clean and the Spa Centre is very good. The food is good but not exceptional and the service in the resturant was inconsistant and sometimes caotic. The deal we got with Citalia was very good value, the room allocated to us was spacious considering we opted for a standard room. Would I go back, probably, but the staff need to get much better at understanding that it is the detail which makes an hotel stand out from the rest!

Title: Spa hotel
Text: Excellent service and food delicious,however rooms without seaview can be dark,avoid groundfloor rooms as even darker.Had noisy neighbours one night and although full hotel staff superb and found us another room transferring our luggage whilst we had breakfast with no fuss. The staff are the highpoint of this hotel which undoubtedly the best on the island

Title: Sadly disappointing for 5 Star hotel.
Text:
Sadly the Punto Molino in Ischia is not 5 Star across the board. Room not bad 4*.
Breakfast 3* do not go if you cannot eat dairy products, service was slow for drinks and I do not like bacon almost raw, although I tackled this on the second day nothing changed. I have never been 5 * without a chef being on hand to cook eggs, omlettes, pancakes and waffles. On the second day there was a pigeon standing on the fruit in the middle of the fruit table pecking at the fruit, on informing staff the bird was got rid of but all the fruit stayed waiting for guests who had not witnessed the pigeon. Evening meal was 5*. Lunch snacks were very poor at the bar 3*. Swimming pool was excellent but poorly managed as guests thought that if they placed an object on a sunbed it was theirs for the day, guests had reserved sunbeds that were never used because the guests must have decided to stay out all day, they should really follow the Aminta Hotel's (Lake Maggiore) example of sunbed managment. I concur with a previous critic that the receptionist in the spa was not a friendly person. Very few rooms seem to have uninterupted sea views so consider carefully if that is worth paying extra for. We had a fairly good holiday in Ischia despite the above but would not return to The Punto Molino unless the above criticisms were addressed.

Title: Lovely hotel but one haughty lady!
Text:
On arrival from the Four Star Hotel Royal in Sorrento, we were initially disappointed by the five star Punto Molino as although we had not paid for a room upgrade, we didn't have a balcony. After a few exchanges with the hotel reception staff who appeared to give conflicting information about the rooms on offer, and after the intervention of or Citalia rep, Rosetta, we were given a balcony room the following day with the staff taking care of the moving process. 

The food is excellent with prosecco at breakfast and a good choice of menu in the evening.  I really liked the way that the food is brought to the table in tureens and served to you individually.  There is a good and reasonably priced wine list.

All the staff have been very helpful, except one: the extremely haughty receptionist at the spa.  She does not know how to smile, make eye contact or greet you with anything other than a sneer.  After our intial consultation with the friendly doctor, she just began allocating sessions to us, without making any conversation.  She appeared to think it was strange that we might want to chose when we wanted the treatments. When we arrived for our first session we were kept waiting without any form of greeting and when we asked she shrugged, grudgingly uttering un momento.  Needless to say we left without waiting any further.  Unfortunately she lets what is otherwise a good hotel down.

Title: Excellent in every way
Text:
When planning to visit Ischia it was not easy deciding on where to stay as so few people we know had actually stayed there - only visited for the day from the mainland.  We finally decided on Punta Molino Hotel after some help from the Trip Advisor Forum - many thanks everyone !  

We were not disappointed - this is an exceptionally well run hotel thanks to the excellent management.  It is perfectly located with impeccable service throughout.  We booked half board which was a very good move as the food was of a high standard and the attentive service in the restaurant  left us wanting for nothing.

We opted for a front sea view superior room with balcony which was perfect - the room was bright and cheery and we we had lovely views from the balcony.  It was spotlessly  clean as was the whole hotel.

We are quite well travelled and have stayed in several good hotels around the world and would not hesitate in recommending this hotel to anyone looking for a 4*+ hotel on the island - we enjoyed our stay very much and hope to return.

Title: Wow- What a find
Text:
We decided we would visit the Bay of Naples and planned a trip spending three days in Naples, Sorrento, and Ischia. It was good fortune that we found the Punta Molino, a five star hotel in Ischia: we appeared to be the only British people there. From the moment we were greeted we knew we were in a hotel oozing with charm, efficiency and class. Our room, which was one of the lesser ones, was a delight, had its own balcony  and was kept spotlessly clean by unobtrusive staff. We took a half board package booked through Citalia and would recomend the half board deal. The food was perfect and the staff of the highest order; they immeadiatly knew us by name and were friendly, courteous and helpful with choices of both food and excellent wine. 
 The hotel has one indoor pool and two outdoor. I have to say we never got past the outside natural thermal pool which was at a temperature of 35 degrees and incorpoated water jets to massage tired muscles. The Hotel is a Spa and has an amazing array of treatments; it is an ideal base to expore the island and then relax in the spa suite a sample of which was included in our package. 
 The Island of Ischia is large enough to be interesting and small enough to get around easily using the inexpensive bus service; we purchased a two day pass which took us everywhere for under 7 euro all in. Our favourite visit was to a garden created by William Walton's wife, Susanah, which was immaculately kept and had stunning views of the bay with seats to appreciate the surroundings in comfort.
 I do not think that the hotel is suitable for activity focused thrill seekers; there were no tennis courts, bicycles or watersports but for discerning adults who like comfort, brilliant food, friendly staff and relaxation amid a beautiful island; this is the place for you. We have seldom been to better.

Title: Popular with an older crowd, needs some updating, definately not "trendy"
Text:
After reading that this hotel was listed in the "Leading Hotels in the World" guide we were optimistic and looking forward to our stay at the Punta Molina which we had booked through an agent.
On arrival we were met with smiles and shown to our room which was spotless however very small.  The room did have the sea view advertised however we were looking over a large expanse of flat roof and then between some other structures to view a slice of ocean.  
The shower room was small and you had to perform a slight shuffle to be able to get in and close the door behind you.  Once in you had everything that you needed including one of the smallest shower cubicles that we had ever used.
We had informed the travel company that I was pregnant so the complementary bottle of Spumante was enjoyed by my husband and after the compulsary consultation with their Doctor (who asked several personal questions!?!) I was advised that I should not use their pools and they would rather not carry out any spa treatments on me which was a real shame as many of the guest did seem to be enjoying the use of the spa and facilities (I should point out that I am fit and healthy and in my early 30's)
There was a cabaret act singing each evening which was enjoyed by the older guests.
After a sweltering first night eased by opening the windows which meant that we were then kept awake by the noise we mentioned that our air con was not working to the chap on reception who agreed with us that there was no air-con working in our room (great, very helpful!)
The Hotel are clearly proud of their inclusion  in the Leading Hotels Guide with copies of the guide on every surface and even on their toiletry bottles however we have definately stayed in much, much nicer hotels with a more luxurious feel.  Perhaps the hotel was in its day quite fabulous however I am still trying to work out how they get away with claiming it to be 5 star!??!!  We would say 3 or 4 at a push
P.S. Inkeeping with the rest of the Hotel they only had one rather ancient PC on which guests could access the internet and that crashed immediately before I could check my e-mails.  Staff response was "sorry I dont know how to fix it"  Of course with a very friendly smile :-)

Title: A stunning resort in an amazing island!!
Text:
I just got back from a quite and relaxing weekend in the Ischia island. Following an advice given by a friend I decided to book a junior suite room in this resort. Set apart in an amazing landscape, I spent one of the best holidays ever! 
The food was really good and the staff extremely helpful. The amenities, ranging from several swimming (also fed by fresh water) to an all-inclusive Spa, contributed to make our stay even more enjoyable.

Title: The perfect spot in Ischia Porto..had a great experience!!
Text:
Last summer I spent one week here to get away from the intense London life with my boyfriend. Well, it was worth any single penny as it proved an amazing holiday in the best venue I could have thought of! Can only say good about the hotel and would definitely recommend it for a holiday in the perfect location of Ischia.
The hotel is literally two steps away from the seaside..we simply had to cross the street to be on the beach!!! and our room had a breat-taking view of Ischia's characteristic Aragonese castle, which is definitely worth a visit! Not only we could easily walk to the beach, but we could also be in the very heart of Ischia porto in a matter of few minutes thanks to the hotel's convenient location. Indeed we were incredibly close to the main shopping and nightlife area, but at the same time set apart from the crowd in a very romantic venue facing Naples and its islands.. The standard of rooms and service was excellent...not to say the food, I would say above any standard!! truly delicious for any meal we had at the cozy restaurant overseeing the sea. Plus, it's a gorgeous hotel with fine furnishings and exceptional amenities..indeed we indulged in deeply relaxing treatments at the hotel's Spa, which I believe is a key point of the hotel.
What to say, we had an amazing experience!!! I'll definitely go back!

Title: I love it!!
Text:
I stayed at Grand Hotel Punta Molino this September for a long weekend. 
I really loved it. The service was excellent, the room had an amazing view, it was nicely furnished and with nice ambiance.  The hotel has a very good location, on the beach and at walking distance from the centre, shops and restaurants. It has a unique view on the Castle Aragonese and the island of Procida. very romantic!
I will definetely return. In fact I am planning to go back next summer!!

Title: 5 star in name only
Text: This hotel is polular with Germans, about 90%. Sunbeds are taken early and not managed by the hotel as you would expect from a quality hotel. Bar staff are competent and friendly, The restaurant in the evening resembles an old peoples home and the food is poor. The staff are not competent silver service. At lunch courses were dumped on our table while eating previous courses so staff could close up and turn out the lights, Amazing! ooms are average but avoid putting cloths on top shelves in the wardrobes as these are not dusted. The hotel falls well short of 5 star hotels on Capri and on the Amalfi coast. It is stuck in a time warp and is not representative of the high standards you find at 5 star hotels in Campania. What a shame.

Title: Elegant hotel with outstanding service
Text:
My wife and I stayed at the Punta Molino for a week and thoroughly enjoyed it. Check-in was extremely swift and we were showed to our room almost immediately. Although we were initially disappointed with the room (due to the balcony overlooking the front entrance) the hotel were swift to offer us an aternative which we decided against. To be fair it was OUR fault for not booking a room with a sea view instead we had a garden view. That said the room was spotlessly clean, sufficiently cooled and had all the amenities you would expect. The only flip side was that the bed i.e. mattress was rock hard.

Service at the hotel is extremely good. Professional, courteous, dignified and friendly. The Maire' d (Francesco) was an absolute delight and took the time to learn our names and always enquire as to our wellbeing. The waiting staff were very professional and attentive. Pool staff, bar staff and reception staff were equally as professional AND approachable with a smattering of English (in some cases excellent) and willing to engage with me in my attempts to improve my Italian. Special thanks to both Luigi and Antonio in the dining room and the excellent Santangelo in the bar.

Food is first class with an excellent breakfast buffet, a la carte or snack lunch and a four course dinner every night. The dinner was a wonderful buffet antipasto, followed by a regional pasta, meat/fish and dessert. Not once could I have complained about the food and the only slight I had is that sometimes the courses came a little too quickly allowing little respite.

The pool area IS small but there is also a small beach with two sunbathing decking areas so there is plenty of room for all.

It is only a short (10 minute) walk to the main piazetta where there is a nice selection of both lively and quiet bars.

All in this is a very good hotel indeed. Recommended for couples who are looking for a quiet break on a beautiful island

Title: I had a good time, a good hotel with some weak spots.
Text:
1) it's a good hotel with high level of service, good facilities and great food
2) the beach is relatively small but it seems adequate although a bit cramped and crowded at times
3) it shows a bit of ageing in small details, a bit of rust here a bit of rush there but fundamentally it's still a good hotel
4) the food is really nice although not 100% perfect. Some of the "antipasti" items could easily be removed highlighting the nicer stuff. I had half board and both breakfast and dinner were nice. I didn't try the cooked breakfast but the continental breakfast was excellent.
5) drinks and foods outside the half board treatment are expensive, something like 10 euros for a iced coffee
6) i didn't try the spa (fully booked every time I tried) and I didn't try the outdoor hot water mini pool because it was too hot; the indoor warm water pool (small) near the (small) gymn, is really nice and convenient after some exercise but it shows some ageing (the water jets didn't work) 
7) my room (single) was a bit small but very clean and the bathroom was almost as big as the room. The desk chair was uncomfortable and so was the armchair, but I had a small balcony with sea view and a view of the fortress and an extra chair and table on the balcony
8) air conditioning was ok, but not too cold so possibly americans or similar people used to blasting air conditioning full power, will think there is not airco;
9) a lot of communal spaces, with comfy sofas indoor and outdoor, where to sit relax, read etc; 
10) furniture is dated and kitsch and could do with a revamp.
11) internet in the room via ethernet cable and wifi in communal areas. 5euros for 24hrs over 7 days, not a bad deal.

Overall a great place and although expensive I would go back anytime, the people working there are really nice and the service is excellent.

Title: As good as ever.
Text: Our fifth visit running and all as good as in my review of 2006. Citalia had an excellent promotion involving free spa treatment. The spa may contribute to the five star rating which some reviewers question although not questioned by  the other annual visitors we always meet or the two couples we have recommended. There are  a number of five star hotels in Italy which we could all  name and which would cost up to half as much again and it is really a question of value for money -- Punta Molino is great value and really it matters really very litle whether or not you see 5 stars or four and a half stars if you are happy with what you get for your money.

Title: Great experience!
Text:
Was at Punta Molino last summer for 5 days. I know Ischia quite well and this was the second time at Punta Molino. It's a pleasure to stay at this hotel. Great position very close to the beach, very good food and an excellent spa.

The rooms are very nice, we got a superior.

Title: Truly Dolce Vita
Text:
We spent two lovely weeks at Punta Molino in July 2009 with my spouse and our middle son who turned 5 at the resort. Surely we enjoyed the place! It was recommended to us by a friend and I did not regret a single second and I still owe my friend a beer.
This is not a place for those who wishes to have enternainment all around. It is certainly not a large piece of property as this is not the case for almost every property in Ischia.
Having read all reviews before I became a bit worried (as always) before flying out there. Thanks God many of the worries dissapeared. The details? Here they are:

Accommodation. 
We stayed at Junior Suite Villa. This was a far better choice for us than regular rooms in the main building. First we liked the ground floor and we got that. Second the suites in the Villa have patio - the fact that we loved immensely. Third you enjoy a piece of privacy there. There are two significant disadvantages though about accommodation at this hotel. 
First is the service. Don't get me wrong, it is good, but not perfect - it was the first time when we get into situation when we hung out "Do not disturb" and went for breakfast but when we got back, our room was serviced! I assume they were very anxious to finish service on time disregarding what their guests want.
Second is the sound. The term 'soundproof' is, well, not about this place at all. Often we fealt like living in a cardboard house. You hear almost every noise upstairs and outside of the room. A friendly chat of gardener and service maid in the morning (if you now Italians) will certainly wake you up if not it was the same maid moving chairs upstairs ten minutes earlier.

Dining. 
This is absolutely the hotel catch. Forget about breakfasts and lunches - although they are good overall - dinners at Punta Molino are something worth the trip. At dinners you get the same reserved table - a very rare feature at many luxury hotels, though a regular at cruise ships. The menu varies and it is stunning. Food is delicious as well as wine and the service is really first class. After couple of days you get used to that and you start to really looking forward to the next dinner. The food is not everything there though. Somehow the staff managed to create a truly dolce vita atmoshpere. Guests are elegantly dressed (apart from few Russians :-)), food is serviced by the table, you do not need to finish you wine - they will bring it tomorrow, view is majestic, staff knows you by name - what else some of you expect from a perfect holiday? Because the hotel is small and everyone is sitting at their own tables, you, as well as other guests, start to recognise each other and appreciate the company of each other. I wish I could speak Italian...

Beach and leasure. 
To my mind the beach is absolutely enough in size for this hotel. Beachmen are lovely and there was never a case when we were left without sunbeds. There are two main areas at the beach (I skip the place around the pool as this was not our goal). The one to the left has more difficult approach to sea for kids when the sea is rough as there are some stones in the water - though there is an easy access there through the public beach. The one to the right is free from any stones, but for some reason we only used that when there were waves.
The good thing to do is to hire a small motor boat through the beachmen (I suspect this is the major source of their revenue for living) to go around the island - these little boats have tents and showers so they are good for snorkelling and just sightseeing We did that for our son birthday and we were all happy.

Other hotel amenities and services.
The hotel is furnished in style and actually did not leave me with an impression of being tired as was mentioned in some reviews. Public areas are well maintained, staff is very friendly and helpful. The hotel CEO is an absolutely lovely character who adds a true charm to the place. Again, the hotel is relatively small and hence they track down the birthdays of each guest and present them with a birthcake at dinner!

Around hotel.
This is Ischia at its best to our view. This island is not splashing money around - the main shopping area is far from Capri or Sardinia. But it is full of Italian charm and hospitality. Safe and relatively quite. After the second stroll the owners start to recognise you and greet you.

Pool and spa.
Pool is nice. Someone wrote that it is shaded in the afternoon. As a Russian family brought up in a place where 30 sunny days a year is a fortune, we actually enjoyed swimming in the shade in the afternoon. The other attraction is a thermal water pool which is always really warm (+37C) and is under the sun and yes, it bubbles if you press a button. My wife tried the spa but was not extremely impressed about it, though I met a lady from Yorkshire who was visiting this spa for 24 years in a row - something remarkable I believe.

Getting to and from the hotel.
Group transfers are normally organised by buses and ferries. We strongly recommend to use personal transfers. It took us around 5 hours after we touched down in Napoli airport to get to the hotel. On the way back we were supposed to be picked up from the hotel at 3.50 am to get to the first ferry to get to the airport at 6 am to spend two hours at the closed check in desk. Instead we booked a private transfer through the hotel reception for few extra euros. We were picked up at 6.10 am and were in the airport by 7.45 to check in in 15 minutes.

All in all - this is a genuine one of the best small hotels of the world at least among those that I visited - and I saw a few. I felt priveleged of staying there and being able to feel the true Italian hospitality. It is not cheap, but for sure worth it.

Title: As good as ever
Text:
Our third visit to this comfortable and relaxing hotel and the more we return the more it feels like home. As usual the staff are wonderful and the atmosphere very friendly. Do not be put off by the hotel brochure which makes it look very formal, it is far from being so. Casual dress is apparent everywhere and ‘smart casual’ dining is accepted as the norm.

The hotel does hold a ‘special dinner’ evening which has been taken on the garden terrace when we have stayed there and the invite to this advises guests that ‘a little of your elegance would be appreciated’. Having said that ‘T’ shirts and slacks were still worn by some male guests but did not look out of place.

Our room this time was not as immediately appealing as earlier visits, when we had a bath / shower, and the room was of quite generous proportions. This year we had only a shower and the room, although with a sea view, appeared a little tired with its dark stained furniture and stained doors. It was however comfortable enough, although slightly on the small side. This would not put us off going again but to be sure of getting a bath rather than just a shower it might be worth going for a room upgrade.

At the beginning of our week’s stay the availability of sun beds around the pool was a problem as in previous years but the hotel appeared a little quieter just prior to our departure on the 5th September when a wider choice of sun beds was available.

The food was, as ever, excellent (part buffet and part waiter service) with good quality meat and the tenderest of beef but also traditional Italian pasta, fish and an excellent varied buffet) as a first and sweet course.

Ischia is so appealing as an island and the ferry transfers from Naples, in both directions, via Citalia, were smoothly executed without any delays and only a few minutes wait at the ferries. Flights from Bristol with Thomas Cook, all via Citalia, were equally as good and on time.

Hotel guest are of mixed nationality with a few British guests, some who have returned to the hotel a number of times.

The hotel’s location is excellent and our visit coincided with a festival on the 1st September which was spectacular, involving a procession of boats and fireworks in front of the hotel followed by a procession through the streets and a finale firework display at midnight. We unfortunately missed the midnight display due to my wife sustaining a serious head injury in a fall in the street on the night of the festival, having to spend two nights in hospital on the island. An Italian hospital stay is not an experience we would recommend whilst on holiday but was one which was made more acceptable by the kind help of the Citalia concierge ‘Mena’ who gave us her total personal attention, visited the hospital and assisted with the communication. She was brilliant. This is one of the benefits of booking via an agent and not booking independently. We would also thank the hospital for the care she received whilst there and although language did prove to be difficult at times we were able to get by, one nurse at admissions speaking some English and an Irish, Italian speaking, male ward nurse helping considerably.

The island itself is still as beautiful as ever although a little marred, in part, by an apparent increase in graffiti in Ischia Port, the main town where the hotel is located.

A few pointers regarding your visit. 

Traffic in and around Ischia Port is manic and more akin to central London than a relaxed island but does have that Italian charm of chaos. Incidentally Italians seems to accept that cars and scooters might appear from any direction and they do not display the English ‘road rage’ characteristics.

 Beware of taxi prices, these are very expensive £20 for a short journey from one side of town to the other (ask for a price before you get in), or better still get a weekly bus ticket if your going further afield via the regular services which circle the island. Alternatively negotiate a deal but be sure that you get the service you are expecting. My hospital visits cost between £20 - £30 for each thirty minute journey.

Also, beware of restaurants offering ‘true Italian food’, particularly at Ischia Port. We heard stories of guests having two main fish courses, costing £40 each, and two other guests who were treated to a typical Italian lunch at the port( lasagne we understand) costing £120 for the two!! Ask for a menu or better still lunch on the beach in Christina’s Bar ( close to Punta Molina), where Calamari, melon / ham, water, wine and coffee for two cost us no more than £30 for two. There are other similar beach bars close to the hotel which are equally competitive and provide that unique Italian style.

Also, if you fancy some clothes shopping beware, you might think Mayfair is cheap after visiting these shops!!

If you going out and about some essential visits are:

The Aragonese Castle, A characteristic castle on the outskirts of town, which is an imposing construction some 115m height on a tiny island connected to Ischia by a narrow dam. The castle contains a serene but uncultivated garden, a terraced restaurant, a comfortable café with spectacular views and is within easy walking distance of the hotel.

Mortella Botanic Gardens at Forio, created by Sir William Walton, the English composer which lies on an enormous volcanic rock, hosting more than 800 rare species of plants. Catch a bus just above the port and stop at some of the coastal towns on the way for a bit of shopping and coffee or enjoy an evening concert. 

Sant Angelo .A busy but attractive beach destination, which is located on the southern coast of the island and is a pretty mixture of hotels and houses, piled higgledy-piggledy on the hill facing the sea.

To summarise an island to either visit and site see or stay put around your hotel and soak up the true Italian character.

Title: value for money ?????
Text:
This is a good hotel , but to be honest it is not a 5 star hotel.

The hotel is set in its own well kept grounds and is meticulously clean, which is not the case outside the hotel where the surrounds are dirty, grafitti adorns walls and you take your life in your own hands avoiding vans and cars on narrow roads. The main town is about 10 minutes walk, which older people in heat may find taxing

The rooms are smaller than you would expect, the bathrooms are  not up to modern standards and  must be considered basic .  The pools at the hotel are small and suprisingly lie in the shade in the afternoons, the beach is outside the hotel grounds and is  only a couple of square yards, however there are  other places reserved for guests on pontoons and a  small rocky headland. Getting a sun bed  for the day is an early morning exercise.

The reception  and housekeeping staff were excellent, being helpful, friendly and efficient. The restaurant and bar personnel  were however of a more unpredictable nature, I suspect that they are not a happy team. The food was average, and not up to 5 star standard. Even though we were on a half board basis , we eat out regularly. 

This is not a child friendly hotel and I would not recommend it for any children.

Title: Not really a beach resort!
Text:
After spending a week at the Tramontano in sorrento, which was supposed to be 4 star, but only delivered 3, we were looking forward to arriving at the supposedly 5 star Punta Molino.  Our initial impression was good - the staff are all very professional and efficient and the location is ideal - just a five minute stroll to the main street.

This hotel calls itself a beach resort - this is very debatable - with taht title you would expect a vast expanse of beach with water sports and facilities, when in fact all you get is a few rocky outcrops and man made beach areas which have loungers and umbellas regimentally positioned by two or three beach/pool attendants.  You do not have to fight each day to get the best postion as everyone is very civilised and once you have been 'allocated' your loungers they are yours for the duration of your stay as long as you take up residence before about 1pm - you can just pop down before breakfast and put a book or some other item of personal property on your chair if you do not intend using it until after lunch.  there were plenty of loungers to go around and there are no 'bad' positions.  We preferred the beach as the pool area  was small and rather lacking in atmosphere and only had about twenty loungers.

The evening meal was superb with a vast array of hors d'oeuvres which was buffet style.  You then chose a starter from achoice of five and also a main course from a choice of five - always one fish and one vegetarian.  this was all followed by a buffet table of desserts which were all rather similar, but there was a good choice of cheese and biscuits and fresh fruit.

The breakfast however was very disappointing.  There were only unappetising scrambled eggs and boiled eggs on offer, with an occasional sausage thrown in.  The main chioce was pastries and a good selection of breads and buns - although no toast or toaster!

There was a choice of tinned fruits and a bowl of fresh fruit salad.  The coffee was the best part of the breakfast.

We ate at the little cafe on the beach most days and it was delicious and reasonably priced, freshly made pasta dishes and salads.

We loved Ischia, but once you have walked up and down the main street afew times, there is very little to do.

The biggest disappointment was on our last day.  We were being collected from the hotel at 2.20pm so had a morning on the beach.  We had to give up our room at 12 noon and were told we could use the facilities in the 'Therme' (spa).  This consisted of a pathetic and rather grubby shower, where you had to run around to get properly wet.  when I asked for somewhere to plug in my hairdryer (lucky I had one because there was none offered by the spa) I was directed to the diabled toilet which had a mirror over the sink and a plug nearby.  this was also grubby and there was no air conditioning - supsequently I could have used another shower as I was hot and sticky by the time I had blown my hair and got dressed.   We even had to go to the pool/beach attendent to get towels!

Title: Ischian gem
Text:
Spent a relaxing week here and found the hotel very acceptable although would question its 5* rating. Staff were extremely helpful and polite and could not do enough to help us. The real weakness was the beach which  was rather narrow and crowded. Sunbeds were available and could be reserved but the best ones seemed never to be available.......and rarely used!  Perhaps a hefty tip might have improved our prospects. Giant sized Russians obviously had the where with all to get the best! I wasn't going to agrue with that! The pool was OK just, but the thermal pool was fun 35 degrees mostly but 39 degrees on one day. Our superior villa were very good...tidy clean and extremely comfortable etc. Air con was fine. as was the small private garden. But no view of any merit. Food  was great. Excellent buffet starter, fish was fantastic. Avoid steaks which were rather fatty. Those with a hefty appertite will certainly not be diasappointed. Did not try the Gourmet Restaurant. Sadly breakfast came too soon after dinner but there a great selection to tempt all.
Hotel location is superb (for my wife) ... only a few minutes walk from an array of fashion shops. D & G, Prada, Armani, Hermes, Versace  but sadly no M&S or Matalan.
For those who want a quiet restful break and for whom good food is important with some designer shopping  thrown in then you can't go wrong with this hotel. But don't be dazzled by the 5*, more a good 4*.

Title: HOT HOT HOT
Text:
We had a short stay at the end of our Summer holiday. Staff was very polite. Hotel very old and a bit run down. Took a junior suite and the air conditioning totally inadequate. They were very sympathetic at the front desk but did nothing about it! $700 a night and we had to sweat between our sheets!

Pool was nice but the beach as most in Italy, was a joke. Walking distace to town, lots of shops and good food. Very busy in July and HOT!

Title: all it promised.
Text: This is a luxurious hotel that provides all that it claims and is quite charming in a glorious position yet near the shops and cafes of the Town. Perhaps unusually, the staff for the most part speak excellent English and German and also Italian. being in Italy.The whole ambience is easy going and the word "luxury" springs to mind again. For the most part the visitors will be mature in age and behaviour and you can rely on the fact there there will be little fowl language,raucous parties and most guests seem to be happy to drink out of a glass rather than the bottle.

Title: Loved it
Text:
We read some of the reviews before departing on our holiday and I must say we were a little concerned, but I'm glad to say it was unfounded. We also have been to many four and five star hotels  and OK if you compare it to some other five star hotels, lets say the Hermitage in Monte Carlo you are going to be very disappointed but there again your not paying Monte Carlo prices. All I can say is we had a fantastic time the staff are wonderful nothing was too much trouble, the room we had was comfortable,spotless and more spacious than expected. Its great at breakfast  you can go down in your robe, dinner was excellent plenty of choice and service was great.  We ate in the Le Gourmet one night which was very good and well worth doing. Both towns are within 5 to 10 minutes walk with great shopping and bars to watch the world go by.

All I can say is we had a fantastic time,  would we recommend it most definately, would we go back yes next week if it were possible.

Title: Great hotel, friendly staff, amazing island
Text:
This hotel is great, i had my 19th birthday there and didnt feel to young at all (they supprised me with a birthday cake after dinner on my b'day which was a nice touch), i was treated the same way as everyone else. I felt more out of place in the shopping area on the island being the only person with blonde hair and pasty white skin lol then being to young. 
Me and my partner stayed in one of there suites, we had a bedroom and seprate lounge both with 2 armchairs and flat screen tvs, we also had 2 bathrooms, one with shower and one with a whirlpool bath. On arrival the staff were extreamly friendly and spoke ok english as we dont know any italian at all. Room was imaculate cleaners came in twice everyday, once to clean and once to lay the beds in the evening and leave us bedtime treats.
They have 2 pools both clean, one with hot thermal water. There beauty farm is quite small but there treatments are to die for (the only downside is that the beauty theraphist didn't speak to much english so we found it slightly hard to comunicate at times) 
The food was also to die for, a buffet starter of a wide range of meats, vegitables, oils and dressings, mini pizzas, fish rolls ect... chioce starter and main course, and a buffet desert of at least 20 fresh cakes, ice cream, crackers and cheeses ect.... on our final night they layed on a spectacular buffet and brought out a pig, veal, turkey, fish, volancano ect.. all alight on fire, and the dessert was also full of masterpieces , carved flower water melons ect...
There piano bar is quiet most nights, but the singers are good and the floor is bigger enough to do a waltz and a cha cha cha on lol.
All staff were very very very friendly and yea we were the youngest couple there but there were a few familys with children there also.
The island is great for shopping, "SALDI" means sale lol although they dont mark there items down like selfridges over here do, i was buying things and getting to the counter to realise there was up to 60 %off some of the items which was great when i was about to pay  800 euros for a satin suit, and it was 300 and somthing lol. Gucci is no cheaper over there though even thou i thought it might be because its italian.
Ischia castle is a must see (10 mins walk from the hotel) , they have a lovely cafe at the top as well which is nice to eat at. The local pottery is really cheap, we brought some lovely hand painted dinner plates and its nice because you can see them making them. We also went to the st maria festival on the 26th of july which was lovely all of the island got together around the castle to celibrate and it was nice to see there local culturebeing displayed there.
Going back to the hotel, there beach is small but theres public beaches all around there island what are clean. I have visited lots of hotels and places around the world and i did really enjoy it here very relaxing!. The hotel is 5 star exculsive in its own means, its on a small quiet island which isnt the richest place around, if the hotel was in london then it probably would only be 4-5 stars, but its probably the most exclusive place on the island.
Would indeed go again.
please veiw some of my pics of the castle and hotel (i am not a professional photographer and i have not altered any of the pics)

Title: Quality hotel recommended for a relaxing stay
Text:
I too had misgivings about staying at the hotel after reading some of the reveiews from guests staying earlier in the year, however I can say that it was one of the best places I've stayed at in Italy (and that includes around 10 hotels including 4 that were 4 or 5 star establishments - only Palazzo Sasso in Ravello beats it and thats about twice the price!). 

The previous reviews are in my opinion a bit misleading on a couple of matters - firstly re the hotel having 20 feet of beach. This is true but it also has an area next to it with about 20 sunbeds, and additional sunbathing pier with another 20 or so sun loungers, and a further sandy area to the right set above a different section of the shore with around 30 sunloungers / umbrellas which also gives access to a small (public) cove which was usually quiet and great for swimming. This is more space that most hotels in the area have and the sunbeds can be booked in advance (no need for the early morning towel race!). Even at peak times there was always space to sunbathe.

Re watersports being on the other side of the island this is true - however the island in question is the big lump of rock connected to ischia ponte on which the Castello de aragon stands.  On the other side of the causeway - an easy 20 min stroll from the hotel - is a place that rents out motorboats and kayaks.

Re age group agree that most are on the declining side of 50 but there were quite a few (around 30%) that were I would guess under 40 

As far as the waiters are concerned they were some of the best I have encountered in any hotel, with just the right blend of friendliness and professionalism. 

The food was as good as any other similarly starred hotels with 4 choices per course and plenty of variety each day, the hors d'ouvres that could be had before the meal were similarly good (Palazzo Sasso may have been better but that was michelin starred!) 

As far as our room was concerned we had one in the main part of the hotel which was very well furnsihed always kept clean and of a good size. The public areas of the hotel were impressive with antique furniture and paintings in abundance. Finally the hotel arranged all our transfers which ran faultlessly and also booked excursions etc as required. 

All in all an excellent stay at a well run and upmarket hotel

Title: A lively, friendly hotel
Text: Having read some of the Trip Advisor reviews about this hotel (after booking), we were a little apprehensive about what to expect. But the hotel is much better than its critics allow. The staff were wonderful, and made allowances for an unexpectedly late arrival, providing a late dinner. Although the rooms are not huge, they are tastefully decorated and well equipped; we had a nice balcony too. The four-course table d'hote lunch - which we often opted for from our half-board deal - with several barbeque choices and an excellent starter buffet - was good; dinner was sometimes not as good as might be, but was a lot better than many other half-board offers. The outdoors bar, with nightly singers, was better than many similar offerings - there were 100 people there some nights, plenty of them dancing. The Terme was limited - especially with great alternatives a bus ride away; and the beach area is small, though staffed by helpful 'beach masters.' But if you want a hotel close to the shops and restaurants of both Ischia Porto and Ischia Ponte (do try Catriona's restaurant there!), but offering a bit of peace and quiet, this is a good choice.

Title: quiet location
Text: The location is great-away from the noise.The facilities are very good particularly the massage spar.\the "private beach" is a bit of a joke . It is sandy but only about 20 feet wide! The food was a let down. The main course was very limited,not always well cooked and often served cold by the time it rached the table.The hotel was very clean and the rooms were spotless albeit on the small side. The extra charges for a sea view were not worth while.We had a pleasant holiday and the island itself is well worth visiting.For music buffs the William Walton concert is a must.

Title: Not a leading hotel of the world!
Text:
We stayed at the Punta Molina for the last week of our Honeymoon in August 04. After staying in a fantastic 5 star hotel in Sorrento we were looking forward to an even better experience at this hotel. We were so disappointed. On arrival the staff watched us struggle into reception with all our bags and didn't help us. We were then shown to a rather small, dark, totally unimpressive room with a tiny bathroom. We found the pool area shabby and cramped. Some of the tiles around the pool were cracked and the steps into the pool were hanging off the wall! Not what you'd expect from a five star hotel. 
The so called beach was a strip of sand with people packed like sardines- awful!
Most of the staff were rude and definately favoured Italian guests. We felt totally out of place. As one of the other reviews points out - alot of the guests were older.
The food was bland and tasteless. 
After two nights at this hotel we felt totally depressed. We decided to leave and couldn't get any money refunded. We ended up paying out more money and went back to Sorrento to a four star hotel. The four star hotel (the bristol) made the Punta Molina look like a three star- which in my opinion it is! I don't know how this hotel was ever rated as a leading hotel of the world. Don't pay five star money if you are expecting a real five star hotel. You won't get it at the Punta Molino.

Title: Don't Stay Here if You Are Under 50!
Text:
We stayed here for a few days on our Honeymoon last June.  The idea was to live it up in Capri, Positano, and Ravello first, and then stay somewhere cheaper, more relaxed on the water and enjoy some beach time and water sports.

This hotel should not be included in "The Leading Hotels of the World" group!  There is nothing "leading" about this hotel.  The beach is TINY and therefore crowded.  I would actually hardly call it a beach -- it is a "swimming area".  The pool is very small and not impressive.

Everyone at this hotel is OLD!  We made friends with the 1 other young couple we met there.  We felt as if we were in a geriatric institution.  Which brings me to the food -- overcooked and bland.  We only ate there b/c our package included meals -- but by the end we paid on our own outside instead.

The brochure shows that the hotel provides or is close to water sports -- like windsurfing, kayaking, etc.  There are none of these amenities on the resort.  When I confronted the hotel on the brochure of water sports nearby - they indicated that they were nearby --- on the other side of the island!

You are close (walking distance) to the main town in Ischia - so if that is most important, you may consider this area - but I would look for another property.

Where to stay: We enjoyed the area around St. Angelo.  There were many quiet, nice hotels, good relaxed dining options, views, and close to beaches and boat and paddleboat rentals.  Our favorite activitiy on Ischia was renting a boat (which we took over to Capri again) and renting a paddleboat with a "deck" to lay out on and jump out into the water --- we could sit on the paddleboat all day.

Title: superb
Text: We stayed at the Punta Molino in June 2003 for 2 weeks. The hotel is wonderful and the staff can't do enough for you. The food is superb and the location is stunning. A visit to La Mortella gardens on the island is a must especially the weekend concerts.

Title: perfect honeymoon
Text: The Punta Molino is in the perfect place in Ischia. Close enough to the Port and Ponte for shopping and resturants yet noice and secluded. Our room had a great view. It was nice although it could maybe do with a little updating. The service was superb. The staff are all really friendly. The food is simply incredible. Everything is so fresh and there is just so much of it. We would not hesitate to go back, it just had a really nice feel about it.

Title: Easy to see the negative if you are negative
Text: We have been several times, over the years, guests of the structure. Easy to see the negative if you are negative, especially then if you are in the industry. This experience we lived not by technicians specialized in tourist accommodation facilities, but by guests who appreciate what is good on offer. The location is ideal for everything, the courteous and helpful staff, the right breakfast. The care that General Manager Antonio Buono took for us was attentive and professional (congratulations). Waiting for our next moment of relaxation, we need a physiological "restyle" of the entire structure, which has enormous potential. Thank you for your pleasant stay

Title: Beautiful location, with thermal pools and not, private beach.
Text:
Beautiful location, with thermal pools and not, private beach. Ischia Porto is within walking distance with a beautiful walk through the pedestrian center a few dozen meters from the property.
Terrace for breakfast and panoramic restaurant.
Very good breakfast. Normal dinner.
Accurate services and kindness.
Very nice room, we had an upgrade to the junior suite (we had booked a superior sea view).
Some details a bit dated but elegance and comfort are not lacking.

Title: Relax!!!
Text: Fantastic property in the center of Ischia with great services offered such as transfer to / from port. Friendly, friendly and always helpful staff. Special credit goes to Conny, the lifeguards and the girls at the beach bar. Thank you for giving us days of pure relaxation! Straconsigliato .. shame having to leave. We will be back soon.

Title: Everything you need in a hotel
Text: Impeccable attention from all the service, special mention for Conny who helped us, advised and guided us in our stay always with a smile. Super full breakfast and for lunch and dinner the restaurant is impressive. An experience to repeat without a doubt.

Title: I lost some stars
Text:
We arrived in 3 bed & breakfasts, with accommodation in junior suites. The accommodation was not exactly 5 stars: sink that does not flush well, toilet with the drain that enchants, spotlights with rusty spotlights, toilet with an obvious vertical break, the shower adapted in the tub with a copious drop of water with each shower. The rest of the room unclean but spacious. Clear signs of superficial painting, even a nail of a painting painted white and left there without a painting.
The common areas without air conditioning, the lights that come on not automatically in the stairs, where there are lamp holders without bulbs.
Beautiful but dirty pools to die for especially the cold, green one on the walls, bordering on decency.
Other customers complained about dinner and lunch, we fortunately went out. 
Breakfast is for us the only strength along with the reception. Only today we used the snack services, well 48 euros for 1 regular toast, 2 portions of chips and 2 bottles of water. There is the price but the quality / price ratio is unfortunately very low in our opinion.
We hope the new property will do this miracle because the property is in an enviable place.

Title: A structure with great potential
Text:
The facility certainly needs renovation , although there are many elements that can remain . A lovely and strategic location. The absolute strength is the very professional staff and makes up for the shortcomings of the structure. To be redone without a shadow of a doubt the roofs at the restaurant , impossible , the swimming pools ( they have not seen maintenance for years and of course the rooms . The sea view of the first floor is a view of a huge and poorly maintained roof. I would recommend a roof garden. 
In short, a Ferrari with deflated tires. 
I hope that the new property will enhance this beautiful hotel and preserve this great capital of employees of great professional quality.

Title: Relaxation and courtesy
Text:
We had a good time and ,all in all, rather than go into detail if it respects the canons of a 5 star, I would say that it has a good value for money.
A beautiful stretch of sea, three swimming pools, attention from all the services but above all one thing that left me very positively impressed, having had during the stay an episode of cold flu, I was made available to a very good and courteous doctor.
There are places , but there are not many, where the hotel activity is first and foremost hospitality , Punta Molino, is one of them.

Title: A Lighthouse of Hospitality and Courtesy in Ischia
Text:
Punta Molino is always a certainty.
Courtesy, kindness of the staff and everything organized to make you feel good and pampered.
Extraordinary beachfront location.
Beautiful pools and one of the most beautiful beaches in Ischia.
Great breakfast and always high quality raw materials.
Lunga vita a Punta Molino!

Title: A pleasant stay.
Text: Property in a magnificent location, overlooking the Aragonese Castle of Ischia. Retro style (the building is from 1968) but kept overall well. Hearty breakfast. There are 3 swimming pools plus a private beach, as well as a SPA. Commendable staff: you sense the desire to "do well". They solved with class a problem with the laundry (charge not included in the final bill and apology cards with gratuity). Recommended for a quiet and relaxing stay.

Title: 5 stars on paper but not in reality
Text:
The location is excellent with a view of the sea and the Aragonese castle. Despite being in a very quiet area, in a few minutes on foot you can reach Ischia Ponte or Ischia City. The external area of the structure is beautiful although, in my opinion, it should be looked after with more attention. 3 stars for the rooms that are absolutely not at the level of a 5 star, old with uncomfortable beds and light coming through the windows in the morning. The spa and gym area should also absolutely be renovated. Very good and plentiful breakfast. We did not use the restaurant/bar service due to the prices, which were decidedly too high. Another flaw is the port-hotel shuttle service which is only active from 9am to 5pm...and who arrives later or has to leave early?!
In short...5 stars on paper but not in reality.

Title: Relaxing weekend
Text:
The hotel is located in Ischia Porto in a quiet area and in any case 5 minutes from the main street (walking and walking).
Very comfortable private beach. Very beautiful, well-kept and well-kept (I think it is one of the few structures in Ischia to have a private beach, inside the structure, without boats, dinghies, etc. moored).
The swimming pools (both indoor and outdoor) are well maintained.
The hotel is a little old (they report that restoration work is planned by the new ownership next year) but it is very well kept with attentive, polite, kind and very professional staff.
The staff itself is the strong point of this hotel, starting from the cleaner up to the manager (kind, polite person, always present and attentive to every need and request of the guests).
The spa is very comfortable with excellent staff. Good at massages.
Huge park with a beautiful garden that is always well cared for.
Excellent morning breakfast (with amazing Ischia croissants) and good dinner (with dishes prepared to perfection).
The hotel's shuttle service for pick-up and drop-off to the port (included in the room price) is convenient and intelligent.
We spent a wonderful weekend and the following one, precisely because we had such a good time, we returned!
Good value for money.
I highly recommend it.

Title: PUNTA MOLINO A DREAM
Text:
Truly relaxing week!!!!Magnificent location!!!!!
Thanks to everyone from Elena who assigned me a fabulous room, from the Director always present to Conny at the reception, to the room staff, to the lifeguards, to the ladies on the floors, very clean room and to the driver Ciro always ready to help me and with the smile!!!! To return!!!!

Title: Breath-taking view!
Text:
Breath-taking view!
Very beautiful structure
Too bad the rooms are a bit old
But I have to say that the breakfast is truly fabulous
The proximity to the small beach and the platform make the holiday very relaxing
The location is also not to be underestimated given the proximity to the center

Title: Scenic hotel
Text:
Scenic hotel by the sea, comfortable rooms and bathrooms, clean, a little tired. Friendly and professional staff with the exception of the little blonde with a ponytail at the reception who only said hello if she had to. Turndown required with a sweet on the pillow, perhaps better a flower petal. There is no coffee kit in the room and 1 bottle of water per night
The swimming pools are beautiful and the entrances are convenient
Good food and breakfast

Title: Excellent location and private beach
Text: Beautiful hotel in its spaces, 5-star hospitality, rooms and everything else in classic and Vietri style, a little dated but well kept except for a few small repairs to be made. Its strong point is the position and the private beach, I recommend it but a little dear if you prefer a new and modern style go elsewhere, however it respects the island style very much

Title: A high five..."cuddles"...
Text:
Rather than five stars, it would be appropriate to talk about five cuddles: this obsolete parameter should be replaced by this more current and realistic indicator. Well yes, in this hotel everything is based on offering the guest a pampering holiday!! Fascinating structure, with a sixties/seventies flavour, very central and equipped with a private beach facing the Aragonese castle, it also has indoor and outdoor thermal pools in which you can spend the last hours of the day in total relaxation as you come up from the beach. Beautiful and quality breakfast with lots and lots of staff at your disposal and, added value, an adjacent restaurant overlooking the sea, the historic "rangio fellone", a real roundabout on the sea where you will find, for those who want it, evening entertainment with music soft and a classy piano bar.
Highly recommended for a top holiday!!

Title: A small paradise in the heart of Ischia Porto
Text:
Definitely one of the best hotels on the island, in the center of Ischia port but in a very quiet street on the sea. Very kind and highly trained staff, ready to satisfy every customer request with a smile. Excellent cuisine, both for breakfast and lunch/dinner, wide choice of products and exceptional quality. The property offers various beaches and 3 swimming pools (2 thermal, one of which is indoor). Perfect cleanliness both in the common areas and in the rooms. Another little gem is the care of the gardens, truly breathtaking! I will definitely go back.
Pet friendly hotel 🐾

Title: Perfect holiday
Text: The hotel is beautiful, the staff is perfect, very professional, the food is excellent, the breakfast is rich, the location is amazing, the position is strategic, we will definitely return, super recommended for both couples and families

Title: When what you write doesn't correspond to the truth!
Text: For several years now, in August, I have been spending my holidays at the Punta Molino hotel and I am sorry to read such harsh reviews, considering that right now I am inside the hotel and I can assure you that Punta Molino offers much more than what is written: the food is good both in the buffet and in the menu formula, the staff is professionally valid and in any case very polite in following the customer in the best possible way. Of course, everything can be improved, and it must be, but I absolutely don't agree with what was stated in the two previous comments which seem more like an attempt to take revenge rather than write the truth in a review! Now, it must be said that the hotel must be renovated in all its lines of service offering, starting from the structure, modernizing some rooms, making the hotel more comfortable etc.. to offer its customers an always more attentive to their needs. I consider myself a "loyal" customer of this splendid structure, whose location is among the best in Ischia but I am also aware that the hotel is facing a management change whose best results will only be seen in some time, perhaps by adopting a more appropriate and fair pricing policy that we all hope for. A loyal customer

Title: Experience not to be repeated
Text:
It made me want to take a ladder and erase at least a couple of stars from the sign. (Checco Zalone style)
Terrible cuisine, undrinkable coffee, smelly sofas, air conditioning not present in the common areas. Sorry but you are absolutely not 5 star, the services there are something completely different. But on the other hand you only have 5 star prices.

Title: A Disgust
Text: It was a 5 star, with the new management it doesn't deserve 1…. Terrible catering from breakfast to lunch and dinner, very slow service, poor variety of food, awkward staff, if it weren't for the few who still work there from the old ownership, it would be a disaster. To those in charge of the new management I feel like saying: Change job, it's not for you

Title: Rest with charm!!!
Text: Hotel equipped with all comforts... Beautiful view, excellent room service, friendly and helpful staff even on the beach! Private beach equipped with everything.... Excellent breakfast... Truly a holiday to never end!!! Thank you for all the well-being you have given us!

Title: Nach über 20jähriger Zufriedenheit jetzt sehr schlechte Erfahrungen
Text: Durch neuen Pächter seit 2023 ist die Entwicklung für Stammgäste äußerst traurig:  Unzumutbares Speisenangebot hinsichtlich Qualität, Zubereitung, Geschmack, Abwechslung, kein Vorspeisenbuffet mehr. Beim Frühstück Zahlungsaufschläge für weich gekochtes Ei 8 €, Spiegeleier 12 €, Omelette 15 €, Benedectine Eier 20 €!!  Neues Personal höflich aber unerfahren. Kein 5-Sterne-Niveau mehr, unangemessenes Preis-/Leistungsverhältnis.

Title: Struttura Da Incubo!
Text:
L’albergo pubblicizzato come un 5 stelle non rispecchia minimamente quanto descritto sul sito. 
Camere con innumerevoli disservizi.
Bagno rotto
Doccia sporca con guarnizione staccata
Phon rotto 
dal faretto luce scorreva L acqua 

Pulizia non idonea
Servizio personale lentissimo 
Ristorante da chiudere ( abbiamo ordinato una pennetta al sugo per la mia piccola , ci è’ stata portata due ore dopo. Il resto dei piatti che abbiamo ordinato erano tutti sbagliati  dopo 1 :30 di attesa, sala ristoro non raffrescata ed i camerieri erano sudatissimi . 
Piscina sporca non pulita, con il piatto doccia per scendere in piscina rotto e sporco . 
Pulizia INESISTENTE  DELLA PISCINA E BORDO PISCINA 
Onestamente e’ vergognoso che un hotel 5 stelle di presenta così.

Title: Ottimo Soggiorno
Text:
Magnifico Hotel in splendida posizione, personale qualificato e accogliente,ricca e variegata colazione dal dolce al salato, ampi spazi comuni bel giardino ottimo il Ristorante Interno eccellente cucina del territorio  con ampia carta dei vini, grazie al personale di sala e non per la professionalità e discrezione Complimenti
Antonio Diana

Title: Struttura top
Text: Sono stata in questa struttura il ponte del 25 aprile, servizio eccellente sia in camera che in spiaggia. Il ristorante anche funziona benissimo sia per la colazione che per la cena. Lo consigliò assolutamente

Title: Hotel datato ma stile e charme affascinano ancora
Text:
Hotel datata ma molto ben mantenuto. Arredi stile e charme conservati con cura. Personale eccellente. Professionale, cortese, gentile, prodigo di cure ed attenzioni per gli ospiti. Il tutto con classe e discrezione. Abbiamo cenato due volte con alternanza di chef. Entrambi bravissimi. Cene eccellenti. Dovrei nominare tutti quelli che si sono presi cura di noi ma sono stati in tanti (tra loro anche il tecnico-mago dei televisori che ci ha permesso di vedere la partita del Napoli e l'autista Ciro) per cui mi limiterò a citare (per tutti) i rispettivi "chief": Elena per la reservation & booking, Ciro per la Concierge e Peppe per la ristorazione. L'Hotel è in posizione strategica. Centrale (5 minuti a piedi sia per il centro di Ischia Porto che per Ponte) ma in zona tranquillissima. Spiaggia privata ed attrezzata il che lo rende ancora più unico ad Ischia dove credo siano pochissimi se non rari gli alberghi con spiaggia privata. Ovviamente non tutto è perfetto. Unica mia lamentela, no pardon!...rilievo (perchè di lamentele in senso tecnico non può parlarsi), riguarda la camera che più di ogni altro rispecchia l'epoca di realizzazione dell'hotel (qualche metro quadro in più e quindi un guardaroba più ampio sarebbero stati ben graditi però il letto è molto comodo e la pulizia quasi maniacale) ed il bagno dove mancavano (almeno nel mio) il portasapone sul lavabo ed i ganci per appendere asciugamani/accappatoi. Altri rilievi: il bicchiere di carta come contenitore di dentifricio e spazzolini non è ammissibile in un Hotel 5 stelle ed è da migliorare l'aerazione. 
I miei amici ed io abbiamo deciso che ogni qualvolta vorremo trascorrere un periodo di vacanza ad Ischia sceglieremo convintamente il Punta Molino.

Title: Aspettative pienamente confermate!
Text: Ottimo hotel, in zona strategica (a metà strada tra Ischia porto e Ischia ponte), vicinissimo al centro. Cinque stelle sono meritate, la colazione è abbondante come pure la cena serale, con ottimi piatti a scelta. Camera tranquilla con vista giardino, personale competente e disponibile. Consiglio la scelta per questi motivi.

Title: Vacanza stupenda
Text: Hotel bellissimo in stile retrò’, pulitissimo ,personale gentile e attentissimo, belllissima la location , belllissima la baietta in cui si affaccia, difronte al Castello aragonese, lettini comodi e bagnìni sempre atttenti all ospite.Ottima spa, e piscina termale.Inoltre farai colazione guardando il mare.Camera confortevole, pulitissima, silenziosa, circondata dal verde

Title: Vacanza
Text: Come da molti anni siamo tornati al Punta Molino, non stupisce sentirsi come a casa, il personale tutto sempre disponibile ed attento soddisfa ogni nostra richiesta, l’albergo è splendido arredi ed accessori ricordano le belle ville di un’epoca passata ma mai come ora apprezzabile. Siamo stati bene ci torneremo sicuramente, consigliamo questa struttura a tutti gli amanti del bello, del confort e del relax.La posizione è unica dall’hotel e dalla spiaggia si può godere di una vista incomparabile sul mare e sul castello Aragonese, buon  soggiorno a tutti coloro che lo sceglieranno non rimarranno delusi.

Title: Non potevamo scegliere di meglio!
Text: Il nostro soggiorno è stato splendido, non potevamo desiderare di meglio! Siamo stati in una delle superior suite, elegante, confortevole ed in una posizione perfetta. Dotata di vasca idromassaggio e doccia a parte. Ha una splendida vista del Castello Aragonese sul mare, la spiaggia si trova attraversando la strada. È dotato di diverse piscine ma quella che più ci è piaciuta è stata quella termale, piacevole stare a bordo piscina e guardare il castello. Il ristorante dell’albergo è ottimo, abbiamo mangiato benissimo, con cibo freschissimo e di qualità.  Infinito è il buffet colazione, con larga possibilità di scelta tra dolce e salato, ma anche un menu a la carte. La posizione dell’albergo è ottima perché vicina alla spiaggia e in pieno centro per una passeggiata tra i negozi. Non potete scegliere di meglio! Non vi deluderà!

Title: Splendido hotel
Text:
Ho trascorso un incantevole soggiorno di 10 giorni . Tutto perfetto. Colazione favolosa ,  stanze silenziose e pulizia eccellente . 
Ma soprattutto la posizione dell’hotel e la spiaggia privata rendono  il soggiorno unico .
Ritornerò sicuramente .

Title: La certezza di coccole e attenzioni
